speaker: Lord Arundel
text: So, we have finally arrived. It has been a very, very long road.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Why are you here, Uncle? We haven't prevailed just yet.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Even better. I decided I wanted to see the end with my own eyes. The very moment that humans will finally be free from the control of that false beast of a goddess..

speaker: Edelgard
text: Understood. Behold to your heart's content, just don't get in our way.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Of course. I could not stand to be dragged into the fighting. When this fight is over, a world completely controlled by the Empire will be upon us.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Not completely... I will only do what I must. But until our reign becomes stable... Uncle... No, all of you. I believe that your power and knowledge may be essential during that time of transition.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Perhaps so. We also will do what we must. For that short while, we will lend your our strength.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes... We're counting on you. For now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, may I speak with you?

speaker: Byleth
text: What's on your mind?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I know the timing is less than ideal, but there's something I need to tell you. I imagine you've already sensed it, but even still... I must tell you the truth...of the power you wield and of what you are.

speaker: Byleth
text: I have sensed it too.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I expected as much.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Have you still yet to realize it? If so, then it's absolutely vital that I tell you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You, like Rhea, share a bloodline with the so-called goddess. Your mother likely had some connection to the goddess, whose power has always been sleeping within you. Five years ago when your power awakened, I was afraid you would choose to join with Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: You thought I would join her?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I did.

speaker: Byleth
text: Five years ago...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. In the Sealed Forest, when you returned from the eternal darkness...

speaker: Edelgard
text: As you know, my goal is to free our world from the control of Rhea and the other children of the goddess. I seek to obliterate her, as well as those around her who use the church's power to control Fódlan. I swore to free the people from Rhea by striking her down, whether or not it meant making an enemy of you. And yet...you came to my aid and chose to walk with me on the path against Rhea. I was overjoyed of course, but I was also confused. I thought that perhaps it wasn't the path you were meant to take. But I chose to trust in you, to rely on you and your strength. And now, here we are.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you for listening, my teacher. I'm glad I finally had the chance to talk to you about it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Please explain it once more.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of course...

speaker: Edelgard
text: After Rhea is gone from this world, I don't know what will become of you. But whatever happens, I hope you know that you're very special to me. I hope that I hold a special place in your heart as well. But regardless...

speaker: Edelgard
text: You are the one person in this world who can share the heavy burden I must carry. Someone without equal who I can always speak my mind to...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's time. Let's go, Professor.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Rhea! Members of the Church of Seiros! Surely there's no reason to continue this fight. What could possibly be gained by shutting yourselves inside the capital of a kingdom without a king? I will give you this one chance...and no other. Throw down your weapons and surrender! Unlike you, I have no desire to unleash wicked atrocities upon this world!

speaker: Hubert
text: Their silence speaks volumes. Shall we commence our attack?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'll wait just a moment longer. There are still many residents within the city. Unlike my attack at Garreg Mach five years ago, the church will not allow the inhabitants to evacuate. What the hell are they planning...

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea...Or rather, Lady Seiros. The Imperial army is calling for our surrender. Is it wise to ignore them? Perhaps we could leave Fódlan and devise another plan...

speaker: Seiros
text: We shall not surrender. We must not lose! Even if it must split the heavens, we shall not yield to the wicked ones!

speaker: Catherine
text: Understood... I will do as you command. You have my fealty no matter what, until my last moment of life.

speaker: Cyril
text: I'll stay by your side too...forever.

speaker: Seiros
text: Now, Catherine. Set fire to the city. The Imperial army will burn in the flames of eternal torment!

speaker: Catherine
text: What?! No, you can't do that!

speaker: Seiros
text: Catherine. Now.

speaker: Catherine
text: As...as you wish. But is there truly no other way?

speaker: Seiros
text: I have no patience for foolish questions. I shall sacrifice as many lives as it takes! That apostate who insists on taking everything from me...will by crushed by my own hands!

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: GRAAAARGH!

speaker: Edelgard
text: That ghastly voice...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Your Majesty! There's smoke coming from every corner of the capital! It seems they've set fire to the city!

speaker: Edelgard
text: What?! Damn it, Rhea. There really is no depth you wouldn't sink into. Everyone, we must commence our attack at once. Are you ready?

speaker: Hubert
text: Preparations are complete. Just say the word.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Then we attack. We'll head straight for the castle and strike down their leader--Rhea, that vile creature called the Immaculate One! This is the end of our long war. After this victory, Fódlan will finally be united and truly free! The capital we're about to invade is engulfed in flames. Do not rush to your deaths. Survive. Prevail. Do that and we'll witness the birth of a new world. I want to see it with all of you at my side. Understood?

speaker: Hubert
text: Of course. I will not fall and leave you without your protector. That you may live to see your dream to fruition... For that, I shall survive and prevail!

speaker: Petra
text: I am carrying the future of Brigid. I will not be dying here! I will be winning. For myself and everyone, I will be surviving!

speaker: Caspar
text: We've been cutting our own path this whole way. There's no stopping until we reach the end! I can't die, or all my great work so far will have been wasted!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Don't worry about me, Edie. I won't fall before I've found my happily ever after. Maybe when this war is over I can finally snag a good catch and settle down!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Somehow we're already here... I wonder if the peace we secure will allow me to research as much as I'd like. If so, let's end this quickly!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Edelgard! Professor! I'll do my best for both of you! If I die here, it would be with shame and regret... Oh, I can't let that happen!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Once the world is united, I will lend my strength to both Edelgard and the Professor. To that end, I will lead us all safely to victory! My pride and duty as a noble demand no less! As do my own principles!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's win this, together!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Imperial army! Black Eagle Strike Force! Move out!

speaker: Edelgard
text: At last, we made it to Fhirdiad, but...it's in a pitiful state.

speaker: Caspar
text: It's so awful to see the Kingdom capital go up in flames, but at least we made it this far!

speaker: Hubert
text: We finally stand before the palace. Though these flames will our friends and foes alike.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Those who stand in our way will perish with the flames. Immaculate One...your reign ends, here and now!

speaker: Catherine
text: With fire raging all over the city, our enemies won't be able to advance in large numbers. Instead, they may try to defeat us with small squads of elite warriors.

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Indeed, I suspect as much. And at their head is the one who stole my mother from me and likely that mutinous whelp, Edelgard.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: The whole city's burning! oh, this isn't good! I'm flammable, you know!

speaker: Petra
text: If possible, we must be avoiding the flame and be careful of strong enemies.

speaker: Hubert
text: If we want to minimize our losses, we will need to be flexible in our approach.

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Open your hearts and accept your fate... The immaculate roar saves only the righteous! GRWOAAAAAARRRR!

speaker: Linhardt
text: What? Her howl as unadulterated magic. I didn't know such a display of power was possible.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: That roar seems to have affected the dolls' movements.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Whenever the Immaculate One howls, those dolls become stronger.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Such power resides in the Immaculate One's roar... We must destroy those golems, and quickly!

speaker: Gilbert
text: I was trusted to protect the future of this nation. The royal bloodline itself! I cannot yield! I will fulfill my duty even if I must forfeit my life!

speaker: Gilbert
text: I can only lament that you chose to side with the Empire. I am a royal knight, and I will destroy all of His Majesty's foes!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Annette...I knew this day would come.

speaker: Annette
text: Yes... And so did I, Father. Be warned that I will push you aside, even if I must use force to do it.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I understand. Goddess...this is surely a chastisement from you.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Majesty... I beg...forgiveness... My promise to you... I...could not...

speaker: Annette
text: Don't worry, Father... I will protect the capital and the whole Kingdom!

speaker: Ashe
text: Our pride, our people, our king. You've torn them all apart. Haven't you had enough?! What else is there for you to take?!

speaker: Ashe
text: Don't look at me that way. You'll throw off my aim!

speaker: Ashe
text: I tried...to do the right thing, Lonato...

speaker: Annette
text: I won't let you take Fhirdiad! I'll defend this place with my very life!

speaker: Annette
text: Why, Professor? Why must we fight like this? Surely there was another path you could have taken that wouldn't have led to this...

speaker: Annette
text: Urgh, it hurts... Help me, Father...

speaker: Gilbert
text: Annette! I will avenge you, my daughter.

speaker: Catherine
text: I will pour everything into this blade--my body, my soul. Thunderbrand rumbles, urging me on. I am the goddess's servant. You will taste my blade!

speaker: Catherine
text: I wish you'd never shown your face at Garreg Mach. I always knew you were trouble, yet I did nothing. Time for me to correct that mistake. Prepare to meet your end!

speaker: Shamir
text: Hello, Catherine. I always knew this day would come.

speaker: Catherine
text: What a coincidence, so did I. It seems that we now have no choice. We have nothing in common. Not our backgrounds, not our beliefs.

speaker: Shamir
text: Not the way we lived...or the way we die.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea... My service ends here. It's been an honor.

speaker: Cyril
text: Get away from Lady Rhea!

speaker: Cyril
text: You made Lady Rhea hurt! I'll never forgive you!

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea, thank you...for everything...

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: I see the years have not cured humanity of its folly... You still wish to hurt and betray my mother and myself!

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Give her back... Give back my mother! Gaaaaaah!

speaker: Edelgard
text: So it's true. You don't value human life at all. Isn't that right, Immaculate One?

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Nonsense! Fools who do not accept their own sins are undeserving of salvation! You humans are the ones who betrayed! You betrayed me, and you betrayed my mother!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I did not betray you or her. I never believed in you from the beginning.

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Give it back!

speaker: Edelgard
text: When humanity stands strong and people reach out for each other...there's no need for gods. Rhea. Your reign of tyranny is over.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The time has come.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm ending this once and for all!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Is it...is it over?

speaker: Edelgard
text: The time has come to invade the Kingdom capital. Or so I declared. In truth, we'll be advancing to a different location. Only you and the rest of the Black Eagle Strike Force can know. Please bear that in mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Hubert
text: Seems you've already anticipated our intentions, Professor. Well done. Before Fhirdiad, we must take Arianrhod, which lies near the border between the Empire and the Kingdom. As a city on the boundary of the two territories, it must be taken at once.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's the plan?

speaker: Hubert
text: There is another location we must take before moving on to Fhirdiad. South of the capital, there is a fortress city on the border of the Empire and the Kingdom. It is called Arianrhod, and we must take control of it at once.

speaker: Edelgard
text: There are many mages within Arianrhod. We will also face Cornelia, a general of the Kingdom. We must also contend with Rodrigue, the head of House Fraldarius, as well as his troops. Once we defeat them, Arianrhod will be ours.

speaker: Hubert
text: I hear Cornelia has a suspicious magic weapon at her disposal. We must attack before the enemy can respond with defensive measures. That is why we are preparing an assault before even our allies are aware. Even within our ranks, there is no way to know with certainty that there is not a rat among us who would leak such information.

speaker: Edelgard
text: When Arianrhod falls, we'll focus on striking Fhirdiad from both the south and the east. The deeper we carve our way into Kingdom and church territory, the more favorable our position. As ever, I'm counting on you, my teacher.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor? Halt! Don't come in here!

speaker: Byleth
text: Hasn't this happened before?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ugh, I thought I told you to forget about that. There's something I don't want you to see.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it a portrait?

speaker: Edelgard
text: So...you know about it. Yes, it's a portrait. Of you. I painted it myself. It's, uh...quite disgraceful. I did a terrible job with it, and it looks nothing like you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you for that, Edelgard.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm happy that you appreciate my efforts, but...please don't touch that door.

speaker: Hubert
text: This was a trying month, but we did manage to hold Garreg Mach—if only just. The power of Seteth and Flayn was certainly a sight to behold. The archbishop's supporters were strong. But with this victory, we have all but cornered the Church of Seiros and its knights. The goddess above shall give away to the darkness that has long dwelled below...

speaker: Hubert
text: This was a trying month, but we did manage to hold Garreg Mach—if only just. Honestly, I did not expect such strident supporters of the archbishop as Seteth and Flayn to flee. But with this victory, we have all but cornered the Church of Seiros and its knights. The goddess above shall give away to the darkness that has long dwelled below...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Dimitri, the King of Faerghus. He despises Edelgard and everything she stands for. I am of the opinion that a man seized by such strong feelings is not fit to be king. It is a sad situation, really.

speaker: Byleth
text: Kings are people too.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: If he cannot suppress his emotions to make reasoned decisions, he should abdicate.

speaker: Byleth
text: Kings can't be emotional?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: No, they cannot. Kingly judgement has to be wholly separate from the emotions of the individual.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: At any rate, I find it hard to believe that Dimitri could defeat Edelgard.

speaker: Linhardt
text: There are stories of Heroes' Relics a thousand years ago of which we have no real evidence today. So many, in fact, that I'm led to wonder if those Relics are nothing more than legends... Especially since we know of Relics like those passed down in the families of the 10 Fódlan Elites.

speaker: Caspar
text: All right! Off to the Kingdom's capital we go! What's the matter? Should I not be excited? I can't help it. Everyone's gotta have something to look forward to!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I've got a dream, you know. Not that I think it'll come true, but it's nice to hope. I'd like to get out of Fódlan and travel across the sea. Maybe to Dagda. Maybe even past that. I want to see all the wild jungles out there, the huge flowers, and--oh--the carnivorous plants! I know it's not realistic, and I know it's probably impossible, but that's what I'd like.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I've got a dream, you know. I don't know if it'll come true, but it's nice to hope. Remember when I went to Brigid, with Petra? I drew a picture of some of the flowers I saw there. Next time, I wanna go even farther. Maybe Dagda. Maybe even past that. I wanna fill a whole book with the drawings of the biggest plants I see! And the carnivorous ones especially! Oh, I hope I get the chance...

speaker: Dorothea
text: I heard that Randolph died in battle guarding Garreg Mach. We knew each other for, wow, more than five years... My chest feels tight. Think about it. There's no end in sight to the fighting. I might be next. Any of us could be.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll make it through together. Relationship with Dorothea goes up)

speaker: Dorothea
text: Together, eh? That sounds like one of Sylvain's old pick-up lines! But yes, let's get through this war. Together.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't see an end to it either.

speaker: Dorothea
text: When the days are filled with fighting, or preparing to fight, it really does feel like this could last forever.

speaker: Petra
text: I have excitement in my heart for secret tactics! I enjoy attacks that are surprising.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why's that?

speaker: Byleth
text: Because it's like hunting?

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. Hunting is like doing surprise attacks on prey.

speaker: Petra
text: Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries. That is a wonderful thing. I have no liking for the thought of losing someone.

speaker: Felix
text: Since I allied with you and the emperor, my resolve has never wavered. I abandoned my country. I am prepared to kill my father, and kill a man I once called my friend. Resolute as I am, my sword feels...heavy.

speaker: Ashe
text: In Faerghus, there's an amazing knight of House Rowe they call the Gray Lion. I heard about him from Lonato, who was an acquaintance of his. Apparently he's getting old, but with each year that passes, he only hones his skills even more.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Some people are so in awe of King Dimitri, they call him the Tempest King. After he wins, there won't be anything left. He'll be a storm, leaving nothing behind. He hates the Empire so much he's willing to do anything to bring it down.

speaker: Byleth
text: He hates the Empire?

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah, because of the role the Empire played in the Tragedy of Duscur. You know, even back at the Officers Academy, he never had much to do with anyone from the Empire.

speaker: Byleth
text: He wasn't like that before?

speaker: Sylvain
text: No. Then again, maybe we just didn't actually know him at all.

speaker: Sylvain
text: We'll be fighting Dimitri and his troops soon. We all oughta train a little harder if we want to stay alive.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Well, that was certainly frightening.

speaker: Byleth
text: What was?

speaker: Byleth
text: The church?

speaker: Mercedes
text: You're very perceptive, Professor.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Having to fight against the Church of Seiros was unnerving. To push back against something I've hinged so much of my life upon... I was terrified. But now we must fight Lady Rhea, and I won't back down!

speaker: Annette
text: I used to live in the Kingdom capital with my parents. I know we've got no choice but to fight the Kingdom, but I really don't want Fhirdiad to become a battlefield... Lots of my old friends still live in the city, and many people there were kind to me. If fighting breaks out there, all of those people might get caught up in it...

speaker: Ingrid
text: I never thought this day would come--that I'd fight my homeland. My betrothed was a knight who served the king. He died bravely to protect the future of our country. Now I'm betraying the place he fought to protect. I'm betraying him. But I must do this. Professor. I believe in the path you have chosen for us.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It seems we will soon set foot in Fhirdiad. I used to live there, you know. Though that was before my time in the Officers Academy.

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you a hostage?

speaker: Lorenz
text: No, of course not. There is a school of magic there, which I was enrolled in for a time.

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you an exchange student?

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's right. I was enrolled at the school of magic there for a time.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Trouble within the Kingdom forced me to return to Alliance lands. There was much I had yet to learn.

speaker: Raphael
text: Hyah! Next up is the Kingdom's capital! We're coming for you! What's wrong? Was that too much? Maybe it was too dramatic...or I didn't yell it loud enough!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Soon we'll assault Fhirdiad, the Kingdom's capital! This'll be one for the history books. Our enemy won't hold anything back. I'm quivering with excitement at the very thought of it!

speaker: Byleth
text: Bravo. You put on a good show.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Heh, I appreciate the compliment! I worried I was laying it on too thick...

speaker: Byleth
text: Your performance is a bit stilted.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Is it? I thought I sounded quite sincere.

speaker: Ignatz
text: In any case, let's do our best! We're coming for you, Fhirdiad! And so on, heh.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I've been informed of the surprise attack. That information could be devastating, were the enemy to find out. It moves me to know I've been trusted with it. Edelgard and those within the army... They really do trust me. Initially, I had my own motives for joining the Black Eagle Strike Force. But now, all I want is to support Edelgard.

speaker: Marianne
text: Even though we're denying the doctrine and fighting the knights, I keep praying to the goddess... When I think about those who have fallen in battle... I...I have no choice but to pray. The goddess of the church may be a fallacy, but I'm sure she still exists in some form. I'm weak. I would be nothing without her.

speaker: Leonie
text: Don't you think this plan to use the entire army for a surprise attack is a bit--I don't know--cowardly? Sorry, the word just kind of slipped out. Maybe don't tell Edelgard or Hubert I said that. No matter the target or strategy, I'll do my job.

speaker: Alois
text: It's hard to feel cheery when you've just gone to battle against old friends. Mraaaugh! No! I will not let myself be gloomy!

speaker: Byleth
text: Go easy on yourself.

speaker: Alois
text: You're trying to take care of me, but it's supposed to be the other way around! Forgive me, Jeralt!

speaker: Byleth
text: How about you go fishing?

speaker: Alois
text: Fishing, huh? That may brighten my mood a bit, now that you mention it.

speaker: Alois
text: I'm sure it must be even harder for you, to fight against your students. When times are tough, just remember, you can always rely on your old pal Alois!

speaker: Shamir
text: Last month's fight with the Knights of Seiros was a disaster.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Shamir
text: Are you asking me if I'm OK with killing my former colleagues?

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem fine.

speaker: Shamir
text: I am. I never believed in Seiros. And my old colleagues are now just enemies.

speaker: Shamir
text: Sometimes it's easier to get by without any personal attachment or religious beliefs.

speaker: Hanneman
text: There's a school of sorcery in Fhirdiad, which is staffed by the top minds of magical research. The study of Crests and sorcery should not be separate. I've often thought I should pay them a visit someday. I never imagined I might end up invading the place with an army though. Not how I imagined it at all.

speaker: Manuela
text: How have we come to this? Fighting the archbishop and her knights... I'd never imagined... I hate this. So much. Professor, I tried. I gave treatment to everyone I could, but...but lives were still lost. The infirmary is as much a morgue right now as it is a place of care and healing...

speaker: Jeritza
text: The Knights of Seiros... They certainly know how to inflict pain. However. The demon within me will be satiated only by fighting you.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Fleche
text: My brother fought proudly to the end and died an honorable death. He said something to me before the battle. That he was entrusting his dream to me... I'm gonna see this battle through to the end. I'm gonna fight for my brother!

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Between Garreg Mach and Fhirdiad stretch the plains of Tailtean. That's the sight of the ancient battle where Nemesis, the King of Liberation, fought the prophet Seiros. If our forces end up fighting our enemies there... It'll be a clash passed down through the ages!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Cornelia! I have a report from our scouts. The Imperial army that departed from Garreg Mach en route to the capital now appears to be marching here.

speaker: Cornelia
text: What did you just say?!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: The speed of the army's movement quickens... They will be here to invade within days. I just sent some of my troops to support the capital. It is likely to be a fierce fight...

speaker: Cornelia
text: How could this be? I have not heard a thing about... Ah... I understand now. I am the target.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: You? Are you sure they do not mean to take Arianrhod for strategic reasons?

speaker: Cornelia
text: It would appear so from the outside. However, the circumstances are not that simple. And will you calm yourself? It will not be a fierce fight whatsoever. The sweet children I have prepared will protect Arianrhod well...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Cornelia...

speaker: Hubert
text: Arianhrod is a fortress city that was built about 400 years ago. Originally a base on the front lines of the battle against the Kingdom, it was built using Imperial money and technology.

speaker: Edelgard
text: However, the head of House Rowe secretly planned to betray the Empire. As the fortress neared completion, it was rebuilt as a base to defend against the Empire. When the fortress was completed, House Rowe declared its vassalage to the Kingdom.

speaker: Hubert
text: Since then, Arianrhod has never fallen. Not once. The beautiful white walls that protect it against its enemies have earned it the nickname the Silver Maiden. In the end, that is all it is to the Empire... the Silver Maiden stands as a bitter memory.

speaker: Petra
text: We will now be destroying that memory. The past is the past. Now is now.

speaker: Caspar
text: A fortress that has never fallen?! Ooh, I can't wait to make it fall!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: How savage of you. And yet, I must say I agree with the sentiment. Let us take the sturdy Arianrhod and continue our march against the Kingdom!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: An invincible fortress? Sounds perfect!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Unfortunately, it will soon no longer be invincible. The Silver Maiden's iron skin is about to be damaged. It's sad, really.

speaker: Petra
text: Is it silver or iron? Use your language with clarity, please.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Really, Lin. There must be a better way to say that. Since we are attacking a heavily guarded place, we must take extra care to prevent allies from getting injured.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you, everyone. I'm counting on all of you. Now, let's resume our advance.

speaker: Hubert
text: This battle is for the future of Fódlan...

speaker: Cornelia
text: How could they deceive me and close in on Arianrhod?! But it's not like I'm just going to just stand by and watch... I will slaughter them all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: So this is the Silver Maiden... Seeing it with my own eyes, I finally understand its strength. Especially the fact that its strength is distributed across its frontal defenses. We'll attack the front and keep our enemy occupied while the others by the east gate.

speaker: Cornelia
text: Titanus, my lovely dolls... Seek out the enemy and destroy them! And if the chance presents itself, I wouldn't mind being rid of those unsightly Kingdom forces too!

speaker: Hubert
text: Are those Cornelia's magical weapons? Impressive.

speaker: Felix
text: Want to die? Step forward. I'll take you all.

speaker: Ingrid
text: We all chose our paths and I've chosen mine. I fight for my lord, to the death!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Traps awaiting us inside the castle... What a nuisance. But with such large-scale traps, there must be some sort of mechanism to control them.

speaker: Hubert
text: The traps are still functional. There must be more of these devices.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The traps are disabled.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I will protect Arianrhod to the bitter end. This I have promised to my ancestors, to His Majesty, and to myself!

speaker: Ingrid
text: You have chosen to assist the Empire, even while knowing of their deeds. I am truly disappointed in you, Professor. Prepare yourself, heel of the Empire! A wretch like you will never be qualified to rule over Fódlan!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Felix, why?

speaker: Felix
text: Urrgh...

speaker: Ingrid
text: You've betrayed His Majesty, Glenn, and Lord Rodrigue. You've betrayed just about everyone!

speaker: Felix
text: You couldn't possibly understand. If you're going to stand in my way, I'll have to kill you.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Sylvain. This isn't funny. What are you doing?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I'm sorry, Ingrid. I believe in what the professor is trying to do more than I do in my own country.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Perhaps my blade will cut away the scales from your eyes!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Maybe...I've become like him...

speaker: Felix
text: There you are, standing before me, ready for death. I will administer the finishing blow.

speaker: Felix
text: Part of me has been waiting for this since I met you. No need for chitchat. Come at me!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Felix? Remember when we were kids and we made a promise about dying together?

speaker: Felix
text: I remember.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Well, seems we're about to kill each other.

speaker: Felix
text: Sorry, Sylvain. You'll die first.

speaker: Felix
text: All that talk about chivalry and loyalty, only to turn against your homeland.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Maybe I'm not a knight after all. Not in the traditional sense, anyway. I've betrayed lord and family alike. And I've done so because I believe in the professor. I fight for that which I believe in!

speaker: Felix
text: So, you won't step aside. Then I'll have to kill you.

speaker: Felix
text: I failed...

speaker: Rodrigue
text: Felix, I'm so sorry... I swear to avenge you!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: I am the king's shield, devoted to protecting the Kingdom, as well as the king's lance, who kills his foes! In the name of House Fraldarius...I will defeat you all!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: So, my foolish son... You took it upon yourself to leave your family behind.

speaker: Felix
text: I'm not coming back. I won't serve the boar.

speaker: Rodrigue
text: It's a father's duty to settle his child's failures. Felix... You must die here and now!

speaker: Rodrigue
text: So this is it... Your Majesty... Please bring us victory!

speaker: Felix
text: Father... I will fight in your stead.

speaker: Gwendal
text: Does a whelp like you really expect to kill me? I am Gwendal, the Gray Lion, a knight by the hand of Count Rowe! Do your worst!

speaker: Gwendal
text: So this is where I meet my end...

speaker: Cornelia
text: Oh my, what a charming guest. Let me take care of you...

speaker: Cornelia
text: Gah! So this is as far as I could get...

speaker: Cornelia
text: Ah... All is in accordance with this carefully crafted script of ours... What a masterpiece! What a delightful dance...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Victory is ours! Arianrhod has fallen! Another army will take control of Arianrhod. As for us, we will take all of the military force we can muster and advance to the Kingdom capital of Fhirdiad. It won't be long before all of Fódlan is unified. Everyone, this is our last push. Our goal is within reach!

speaker: Edelgard
text: What turn of events has brought you so suddenly to Garreg Mach, Uncle?

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Well, my business in the old Alliance territory had roughly finished. I wanted to see the face of my niece, who so bravely took Arianrhod. I have heard that it was done with truly magnificent tact. And that you even deceived some of your allies.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm happy to have earned your praise. However, to say that I deceived my allies is a bit misleading. I despise leaks of information, and there may have been a church rat hiding amongst our ranks.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Ah, I see. However, there are some unfortunate consequences. Cornelia surely planned to betray them, but...she has been struck down. Truly wasteful meddling. Unless... Was it your intention to kill her?

speaker: Byleth
text: It was.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, don't joke about that. The only ones we came to kill were our enemies.

speaker: Byleth
text: It was not.

speaker: Byleth
text: I didn't care either way.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Indeed. We came only to kill our enemies.

speaker: Edelgard
text: She used a terrible magic weapon... Dolls that she could move and fight with. Did you know about them?

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Well now... If that were the case, would it not have been better to keep her as an ally? If you are only capable of such imprudence, this dark cloud might hang over the Empire's future as well.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you for your concern. However, I will sweep aside any darkness that comes our way.

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: I will be praying. Praying that the Empire will not become another Arianrhod.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Another Arianrhod? Just what do you mean...

speaker: Lord Arundel
text: Hmph. I must take my leave now. Farewell.

speaker: Hubert
text: Lady Edelgard, there you are. We just received some truly shocking news. It is said that pillars of light have rained from the heavens and disintegrated Arianrhod.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Disintegrated?

speaker: Byleth
text: How is that possible...

speaker: Hubert
text: It was likely some type of magic... Perhaps a forbidden art.

speaker: Byleth
text: Was it Lord Arundel...

speaker: Hubert
text: Why would he do that?

speaker: Hubert
text: Was Lord Arundel just here? So that would mean...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hubert! Give me the full report!

speaker: Hubert
text: Ah, my apologies. I, of all people, should be able to control my discomposure. The pillars of light descended and exploded, resulting in the complete destruction of the main building and the north wall. It is believed that all key people within House Rowe, including its leader, were killed. Of the Imperial officers and men we kept at Arianrhod, about a third are unaccounted for...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It can't be true... So...this is my uncle's trump card. In exchange for striking down Cornelia, he has destroyed Arianrhod!

speaker: Hubert
text: Perhaps we acted too soon in our disposal of Cornelia...

speaker: Edelgard
text: No. If we'll be fighting them soon, there's no disadvantage to weakening their forces. It's also extremely valuable that we forced them to show their hand. Hubert, the investigation you made into the legend of Ailell, the Valley of Torment... This is likely what took place back then as well.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes... The probability is high.

speaker: Byleth
text: Valley of Torment?

speaker: Byleth
text: The same thing happened in the past?

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, it is quite likely.

speaker: Hubert
text: North of Garreg Mach there is a valley where the earth is always aflame. Once, javelins of light fell from the sky there... They pierced the earth and set the forest ablaze, creating a land of torment. We believed it may have been the work of the goddess, but... It was actually an attack by those who slither in the dark. That sums up all that we know.

speaker: Edelgard
text: By giving us that knowledge, those who died at Arianrhod will not have died in vain.

speaker: Hubert
text: Indeed. It would be good to control the flow of this information.

speaker: Edelgard
text: True. We'll conceal this from everyone as best as we can. I trust you, my teacher.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm sure everyone has heard about what transpired at Arianrhod. The church has displayed their cowardice by indiscriminately using forbidden practices to kill the residents there. Their victims also include members of House Rowe, the Imperial army, and many, many more.

speaker: Hubert
text: According to our investigation, the forbidden attack that destroyed Arianrhod cannot be used again so quickly. Even so, we cannot delay our efforts. We must put a stop to all of this by the end of next month. The leader of one of the Imperial factions has already initiated an attack on the Fraldarius territory lost by Rodrigue... Soon, all obstacles blocking our path to Fhirdiad will have vanished.

speaker: Edelgard
text: A cornered animal is at its most deadly. We must move quickly. Next, we march through the Tailtean Plains. After that, we destroy Fhirdiad. At that time, complete Imperial control over Fódlan will finally be a reality.

speaker: Caspar
text: Ah, I'm shaking with excitement! Bring on the battle!

speaker: Dorothea
text: I understand that a confrontation is inevitable. Still... I wonder if there's some path we could take that would cause less suffering...

speaker: Petra
text: This is the only path for the goal we are reaching for, and so we must keep walking on it. We are walking down the path to a better tomorrow.

speaker: Linhardt
text: A cornered church... Hmm, well, count me out from any forbidden sorcery that can destroy whole cities. If only there was an easier way to get more information on Crests and Relics...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You are as negative as usual, Linhardt. We have but one order. To emerge victorious!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: We're going to win this! We really are! After all, if we lose, everything will be terrible forever! Oh, no way! We can't let that happen!

speaker: Caspar
text: There's a lot to worry about, but...I'm sure it will all work out! We'll win no matter what!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, what is your opinion of Claude? I can't help but wonder what sort of impression he made on you.

speaker: Byleth
text: He's a schemer.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That is inarguable. And his schemes are still going strong. With them, he's managed to keep the Leicester Alliance from the Empire's grasp.

speaker: Byleth
text: He's a jokester.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That much is obvious. He acts like a fool, but still manages to make the impossible happen. That's as true now as ever. He's managed to protect the Leicester Alliance with his cunning alone.

speaker: Byleth
text: He would be a good king.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Interesting... I've never thought of him like that. However, I know you have a keen eye for potential. After all, as leader of the Leicester Alliance, he has managed to protect his entire territory all this time.

speaker: Byleth
text: How has he done that?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Since the beginning, territories within the Alliance have been split between those who support the Empire and those who oppose it. Claude has been acting as an intermediary between the two, essentially keeping the Alliance pacified. As both sides are of equal strength, he's created a situation in which they've all agreed to avoid fighting each other and causing undue bloodshed. By carrying on as though the Alliance is united, he's minimized the Empire's influence there.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. It's quite impressive how well his bold scheme has worked out. However, he is walking on thin ice. One wrong move and the Alliance will shatter.  Speaking of Claude... Your Majesty, we should not delay in our invasion of the Alliance. It would seem that Claude has some fresh scheme up his sleeve, to no one's surprise.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Is that so?

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes. The people of Derdriu have suddenly found it difficult to leave or enter the city. We can safely assume he is preparing for battle, but I am certain his plans extend beyond that as well. Do you not think we should take Derdriu at once?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital... A city floating on the ocean certainly poses a challenge. Since it's deep within Riegan territory, we haven't had the opportunity to attack it directly. However, now that we have control of the Great Bridge of Myrddin, our situation has changed drastically. They can no longer expand their supply line into the Empire, and so we can finally attack Riegan territory.

speaker: Hubert
text: House Riegan is not only Claude's house, but also the flagship of those who oppose the Empire within the Alliance. If House Riegan falls, the other Alliance lords will be tripping over themselves to join us. That is why we cannot fail to take Derdriu.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go.

speaker: Hubert
text: Confidence is one thing, Professor, but see to it that you do not underestimate Claude.

speaker: Byleth
text: That seems difficult.

speaker: Hubert
text: Fair enough. Claude will certainly be a difficult opponent.

speaker: Hubert
text: The leader of the Alliance has had many things said about him... They say he is unbeatable in a battle of intellect. I hear they call him the Master Tactician.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I wish we could settle all of this before the fighting begins. Don't you? I wish it dearly. But few others feel that way. They fight in a bloody battle, take countless lives, and then finally come to understand defeat. They refuse to admit when they're beaten, and they keep it up until they've been utterly defeated. Of course, I understand that sacrifice is inevitable... But if they're going to surrender after being defeated anyway, why raise a weapon in the first place?

speaker: Hubert
text: So, we've somehow managed to take the Great Bridge of Myrddin. That means House Gloucester should now be ready to join the fold more formally. We've blown a major hole in Claude's plans to preserve the Alliance. We should press on to Derdriu before he has the opportunity to adjust his strategy.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I have been wondering something... If I had not been your student, where would I be right now? Who would I be? Do you ever think that sort of thing, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Like what if I had led a different class?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to go back and try a different path.

speaker: Byleth
text: Like what if I had turned against the Empire?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to go back and try a different path.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I see... You are so focused and coolheaded. I wish I could be more like you.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I never do get used to the sight of blood. It always makes me feel as if I might faint. I suppose I've told you that though, yes? I've no idea how you cope with it. I hope this war ends soon. I dislike being lightheaded because other people are bleeding everywhere. It's all a great deal of a bother, but I will do my part of course.

speaker: Caspar
text: Didn't they used to call Claude the Master Tactician? I want a nickname too! Maybe I'll get one if I can defeat him at Derdriu... I'll come up with a plan that'll beat his and earn me a nickname for sure!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Claude... Claude... Which was he again? Oh! Right. Yeah, of course I remember him. It's just... I can't picture his face. Don't remember what he looks like. I'm not sure if I ever knew. Oh well. He's just another enemy now, isn't he? What, am I not supposed to say that?!

speaker: Dorothea
text: I'm happy when we win battles, and I'm always relieved when our friends make it back safe. On the other hand, it's hard to watch the enemy die. Even worse when it's someone you know. Perhaps it would have been better if I'd just stayed with the opera...

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Dorothea
text: You're right, Professor. I'll never regret the choices I made.

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps...

speaker: Dorothea
text: No, Professor. I refuse to regret my past decisions.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Now you just have to lead us to victory so everyone else can let go of their regrets too.

speaker: Petra
text: Since the past, I have learned much of the language of Fódlan. But speaking the Fódlan language still gives me difficulty. I can understand, read, and white with nearly perfection now. But understanding and speaking are...fruits of a different color.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's part of your charm.

speaker: Petra
text: I have gratitude for you, Professor. I hope that I will have fluency one day.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone has a weak spot.

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. I will keep practicing more.

speaker: Felix
text: I hear Claude's earned himself a rather colorful nickname. He does whatever it takes to win. I like that. It will be especially satisfying to defeat him. I can't wait to see what his next move is.

speaker: Ashe
text: Food has gotten scarce since the war started. Lately the prices have really been going up. Normally that would mean reducing our own take, but we just can't afford to do that. If we lose this war, we lose everything. Still, the townspeople are the ones who will suffer from this the most. The longer this goes on, the more people will starve.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital... I've heard it's a magnificent city, you know. If we're going, I wish it wasn't to wage war. It'd be more fun to visit with a cute girl on my arm.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe once the war is over...

speaker: Sylvain
text: You're right. That's something to look forward to.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah? Maybe you and me? That'd be a good reason to survive the war. Heh heh...

speaker: Byleth
text: Forget it.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Aw, come on. Let a guy dream.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Flowers are so resilient, aren't they? Despite the war going on outside the monastery, here they are, blooming beautifully. I hope we get to see more kinds of flowers when the weather warms up...

speaker: Annette
text: Derdriu, huh? I've always wanted to go there. In Faerghus, most of the towns are pretty much glorified fortresses. So to hear about a place called the Aquatic capital...it just sounds so elegant! Let's go for a leisurely visit someday, promise? You know...after the war is over.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Judith of Daphnel. You were a force to be reckoned with. You will not be forgotten. In another life, I might have fought by her side.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's done is done.

speaker: Ingrid
text: As harsh as that is, it's the truth of it. It's over now.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand the sentiment.

speaker: Ingrid
text: It's a harsh truth, but it's the truth nonetheless. We can't change the past.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Now that we've seized the Great Bridge of Myrddin, House Gloucester is comfortable aligning itself with the Empire. The path to Riegan lands lies straight before us. Our clash with Claude draws nearer by the moment.

speaker: Byleth
text: Having second thoughts?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Not at all. On the contrary, I look forward to it. My old rival will be a worthy test for me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Will he put up a hard fight?

speaker: Lorenz
text: I certainly hope so. I would be quite disappointed if my greatest rival were to simply roll over.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I know Claude better than anyone. He is a schemer. No doubt he has some trap for us in mind. Let us be vigilant, Professor.

speaker: Raphael
text: We're gonna go up against Claude next? I haven't seen him in forever. Wonder how he's been... I chose this side because I believe in you, Professor. But it's not like I got anything against Claude.

speaker: Byleth
text: What was he like?

speaker: Raphael
text: Hmm... Well, he loved parties, and he was full of some pretty good jokes!

speaker: Byleth
text: Were you close?

speaker: Raphael
text: Of course! Claude was the kinda person who would be instantly friends with anyone.

speaker: Raphael
text: I don't mind so much that we gotta fight him, I just hope he doesn't get killed...

speaker: Ignatz
text: I thought I was ready for this, but it's not easy to fight against my old schoolmates... I was in the Golden Deer House, so I have a lot of memories with them.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you feeling conflicted?

speaker: Ignatz
text: No, I'm not. I decided to fight alongside you, and I will not waver.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's hard for me too.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Really, it is? I wish that we could resolve this without violence.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Then again, precisely because they're old friends, I wouldn't leave this to someone else. I have to assume responsibility.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Without the support of the pro-Imperialist lords, the Alliance is greatly weakened. Even so, I don't feel great about all this. We're gonna be fighting Claude...

speaker: Byleth
text: We must not let our guard down.

speaker: Lysithea
text: We can't--you're right. Claude has such unusual strategies for toying with his enemies.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can definitely win.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Even so, we should stay alert. Claude won't be caught off guard. Neither should we.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Even with you here, this battle will be very challenging.

speaker: Marianne
text: The tide of war is clearly favoring us, but Claude refuses to surrender. I wonder why that could be...

speaker: Byleth
text: It's against his principles.

speaker: Marianne
text: Frankly, it seems to me that his ideals are not that far removed from Edelgard's...

speaker: Byleth
text: The way he sees it, we can't both exist.

speaker: Marianne
text: I think you're probably right...

speaker: Marianne
text: I suppose even the very powerful can be irrational at times...

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm from Alliance lands, but I'm only a commoner. The idea of fighting Alliance nobles isn't exactly losing me any sleep. Fighting old friends though? That's something else. Ugh. I'd better clear my head. Captain Jeralt used to say a mercenary has to be thoughtless. Guess I finally get what he meant.

speaker: Alois
text: Do you ever regret taking the path you did?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Alois
text: Hm. I guess doubts and regrets just come with being human.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Alois
text: Hah, the very model of a leader! I should take a page out of your book.

speaker: Byleth
text: All the time.

speaker: Alois
text: Hm. I guess doubts and regrets just come with being human.

speaker: Alois
text: Whatever path you choose going forward, I'll follow you without question.

speaker: Shamir
text: Claude, eh? He always was sharp among his peers. Never let himself get caught up in conventions. He wasn't typical in Fódlan. Then there's Rhea and King Dimitri... I'd stay on their good sides, for different reasons.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have a choice.

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no desire to kill them, but...

speaker: Shamir
text: Yeah, well... If that's the only way forward, it can't be helped.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Professor, I think you should be made aware of a certain group working with the Imperial army. They are the same lot that invented a technique to turn monsters into war assets. It's quite obvious their trick draws on the power of the Crest Stones, but... There is something more to it than that. Some secret I have yet to decipher. I suppose I need to better understand what kind of people they are. Who are they? What do they want? For her part, Miss Edelgard is cooperating, yet does not hide her hostility towards them. I suspect we should prepare in case the day should come when we must combat these strange people.

speaker: Manuela
text: Remember the Death Knight who stabbed me five years ago? Of course you do. How could you forget? Well, it turns out he's a general in the Imperial army! He leads the western front against the Kingdom. Once I knew he was at Garreg Mach, I stormed right up to him, told him who I was, and what he did... And he offered me an apology. I'm talking about a sincere, heartfelt, solemn apology. What a letdown. What's going on with that guy, anyway? Who is he under that mask?

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, hello there, Professor. Did you need something from me? It doesn't look like you're wounded or anything. You just looking for...someone to talk to?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Manuela
text: I thought so. Well, I'm here for you! Making you feel better is my top priority.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Manuela
text: Come on now, you don't have to be shy. Helping you feel better is important to me.

speaker: Manuela
text: Whether it's physical pain or worries of the heart, you can come to me for anything, Professor.

speaker: Jeritza
text: What is it?

speaker: Byleth
text: I just want to chat a bit.

speaker: Jeritza
text: I have no words for you. I have blades, and if you wish to cross them, I'll be more than happy to. Although you may not be.

speaker: Byleth
text: Nothing.

speaker: Randolph
text: Lately, the Kingdom and the Knights of Seiros haven't made any significant moves. I don't suppose they're going to stand by and watch while we attack Derdriu though. That's why I've doubled our guard and instructed them to be extra vigilant. I will keep Garreg Mach safe! It is my duty and responsibility.

speaker: Fleche
text: Big brother always gets me so fired up... Better keep an eye on him. Oh, sorry! I was just talking to myself. I hear you're heading out to Derdriu. Good luck with the battle!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Five years ago, during the attack on this place, you allowed me to join your side. Since then I've risen through the ranks, and now I'm a general leading my own army. In this invasion of the Alliance, I've been entrusted with maintaining the supply lines and keeping the Goneril territories under control. That's why I won't be accompanying to Derdriu. Please look after Lady Edelgard.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Derdriu is known as the Aquatic capital... It's a beautiful town with streets that seem to float on the water and an impressive harbor. In times of peace, it would be a wonderful place for a holiday... Anyway! Best of luck in the next battle!

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's almost time to depart. Are you ready?

speaker: Byleth
text: Leave it to me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: A promising answer. Whatever happens, never allow your foe to see any weakness.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think we can win.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I agree that Claude will prove a difficult foe. Still, do not speak such words right before a battle.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We must pay attention not only to Claude's schemes but to the man himself. He's a master archer who wields the legendary bow Failnaught. He won't fall easily.

speaker: Byleth
text: Failnaught...

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's the Relic of House Riegan. That bow once belonged to one of the 10 Elites. Professor... Do you know the true story behind the legend? The Relics were created by the hands of mankind. Seiros collected them after killing the 10 Elites. Seiros manipulated the people of the world and defeated the all-powerful King Nemesis.

speaker: Byleth
text: I thought he was corrupted by his power?

speaker: Edelgard
text: That's the history the Church of Seiros maintains. However, it was little more than a simple dispute.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why would she do that?

speaker: Edelgard
text: The church maintains the false history that he was corrupted and turned evil. However, it was little more than a simple dispute.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Should the one leading the people of the world be someone with humanity or a creature that can merely masquerade as a human at will? In the end, Seiros was victorious. The Immaculate One and her family then took control of Fódlan. I know this because that knowledge is passed down from emperor to emperor. And that is the because the first emperor is the human who cooperated with Seiros, allowing humanity to be controlled in secret.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Perhaps it's fate that you can wield the Sword of the Creator, just like Nemesis, the King of Liberation. And that very fate will lead you to use that sword to stand against those who would distort history.

speaker: Claude
text: It seems they've set out from Garreg Mach... That's sooner than expected. Losing the Great Bridge of Myrddin was a serious blow. So is the fact that Teach is still alive. On top of all that...Judith. I told her to run if things looked grim. Damn it. So many people will die, and by my call.

speaker: Nader
text: And what of it? Would you rather turn tail and run back home?

speaker: Claude
text: Nader... You're really getting on my nerves. Do you have any idea how much of the Alliance adores me and believes in me?

speaker: Nader
text: Well, I suppose it's quite a lot. Does that mean that...

speaker: Claude
text: Yes. The plan is a go. I'm counting on you, Nader. We'll make a good show taking down those who would assault Derdriu.

speaker: Nader
text: People say our kind may not always win, but we never lose. Let's teach them the real meaning of those words.

speaker: Claude
text: Now then... Let's see what you're made of, Teach...

speaker: Claude
text: Here she comes, at long last... I've done all I can to prepare. Let the cards fall where they may. It'll be a true test of strength.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems Claude has blockaded the city and occupied the naval port.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. If that is the case, he will have no choice but to engage us from there.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. Though putting myself in Claude's place leaves me with an unpleasant feeling... If we take over the port and close the entry to the city, Derdriu will be under our control. Each soldier should bear that in mind as they advance.

speaker: Hubert
text: There are three gates which connect Derdriu to its naval port. Taking the city will be easy once we secure all three.

speaker: Claude
text: Now it's our turn, Almyra's elite! Strike the flanks of the Imperial army!

speaker: Claude
text: Those fangs and claws the Alliance fears so much will now be their salvation!

speaker: Nader
text: Leave it to us, kiddo! My undefeated streak will live on. Another chapter in my heroic saga!

speaker: Edelgard
text: That flag and banner... Is that the Almyran army? Ugh, you really did it, Claude!

speaker: Hubert
text: This is no ruse. That is Nader, an Almyran general.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Take care of them quickly! Especially those Almyran wyverns!

speaker: Hubert
text: The Almyran reinforcements keep coming. We should try to eliminate Nader...

speaker: Villager
text: We don't have the guts to resist anymore! Here...you can have this! Just please don't attack the city!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I never planned to touch the city. Our target is the Alliance and their leader, Claude.

speaker: Hilda
text: You didn't forget about me, did you? Maybe you should just let me go.

speaker: Hilda
text: Professor! It's been too long. But now we're on opposite sides, huh? What a shame. I'm not going to hold back. I can't let down my dear old Claude.

speaker: Marianne
text: I-I'm so sorry, Hilda. I...

speaker: Hilda
text: It's OK, Marianne. These things happen in war.

speaker: Hilda
text: It's been fun, Claude... Sorry to go so soon...

speaker: Claude
text: Hilda! Why didn't you retreat?! I counted on you retreating...

speaker: Lysithea
text: Don't expect me to go easy on you. Because I won't.

speaker: Lysithea
text: You are here as well, Professor? That is a shame...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Lysithea. How unfortunate that a talented woman like you should throw her life away on a pointless battle.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ha, do not underestimate me. The fight is far from over, Edelgard!

speaker: Lysithea
text: That's the last of my energy. If you're gonna kill me, make it quick. Fair warning though, I'll likely come back to haunt you. It's not like I've had an easy time of it, after all...

speaker: Lysithea
text: You...want me to join you? The Alliance is over no matter what. The only thing left is to place faith in you and Edelgard. There's still so much I have to accomplish. Thank you for the second chance, Professor.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Father, Mother... I'm sorry I didn't listen to you...

speaker: Nader
text: It's been 30-odd years since I set foot on a field of battle. Here's a taste of my undefeated strength!

speaker: Nader
text: The emperor continues fighting at the front line. Is the Empire short on troops?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Unfortunately, I can't deny it. But then, I've heard the Almyran king does the very same. You have traveled far. I do hope it's for a king who would not only lead his army but fight at their side.

speaker: Nader
text: Touché... Yes, he is that sort of king!

speaker: Nader
text: Sorry, kiddo. It seems we'll have to withdraw...

speaker: Claude
text: You've done enough, Nader. Just stay alive. We'll meet again one day!

speaker: Edelgard
text: We have forced the Almyran forces to flee. I doubt they're expecting more reinforcements.

speaker: Claude
text: Heh... So sad that our reunion should take place on the battlefield.

speaker: Claude
text: Teach... You should have chosen me instead of Edelgard. No point in whining about it now, I suppose. Sorry, but I'll be taking the win today.

speaker: Claude
text: We haven't seen each other since Garreg Mach. You've grown lovelier than ever, Edelgard.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You're not so unfortunate yourself. And as usual, you're here at a most inopportune moment.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, I'm sure we have much more to talk about... But how about we settle things first?

speaker: Edelgard
text: No objections here. Prepare yourself, Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, how long's it been? Five years? Who'd have thought you'd end up as an Imperial general...

speaker: Claude
text: Enough! You've bested me. If I die here, the Alliance becomes part of the Empire.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Do you yield, then? You've never known when to give up.

speaker: Claude
text: Well, I can't just surrender so easily. I'm responsible for the others. If you're as smart as you seem, I bet you've figured out why I was able to summon Almyran reinforcements. Wouldn't it be better to let me go and have me in your debt?

speaker: Claude
text: Thank you, Professor. And you, Edelgard. I'm truly grateful for your courageous decision. I will return your kindness one day... I promise.

speaker: Claude
text: I see. Right until the very end, I've read this whole thing terribly wrong... All my hopes have fallen to ash... It's all up to you now, Edelgard... I really hope you do make the world...better...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Everybody! Raise your voices in a victory cheer! Derdriu is ours!

speaker: Claude
text: Hey, Teach.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Claude?!

speaker: Claude
text: Settle down, will you? You're the victor, after all. I could have escaped, but I decided to say hi to Teach. Nothing to worry about. Derdriu has fallen and the Alliance has collapsed. There's nothing I could do to turn things around at this point.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You want me to drop my guard around someone who evaded detection by my soldiers? Impossible. Did you really risk coming here just to say hello?

speaker: Claude
text: I did. But mostly, I wanted to say good-bye. I'm leaving Fódlan.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why are you leaving?

speaker: Byleth
text: Lend us your strength.

speaker: Claude
text: Lend you my... I knew I liked you, Teach!

speaker: Claude
text: I daresay Fódlan would be a lot more peaceful without me around. Right, Your Majesty?

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's as you say. So long as you remain here, the faction of the Alliance that is against the Empire will continue to support you.

speaker: Claude
text: Too true. It's best if I leave this place altogether. I'll just have to find some other way to pay back my debt to you. All I ask is that you go easy on the Alliance. After all, no one there would dare defy you. And please, treat my former classmates well. I've asked them to cooperate with you if I lost.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Wait... Did your scheming include a plan for if the Alliance lost?

speaker: Claude
text: Heh, you think too highly of me. It just seems that way now. Outside of Derdriu, most of the Alliance is unscathed and ready to join your superior strength. In all honesty, I was hoping to become a supreme ruler and lead Fódlan to peace myself. But...that won't be happening now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Claude...

speaker: Claude
text: Good luck to you, Edelgard.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We crushed him in battle and yet... He really is difficult to understand.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Derdriu is ours. The Alliance has collapsed, and their leader has fallen.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did we really have to kill him?

speaker: Edelgard
text: If Claude had lived, the faction of the Alliance that is against the Empire would have never stopped fighting us. To keep the bloodshed to a minimum, he had to be taken out of the equation. However, now that it's over, I can't help but wonder if he was in complete control of that entire situation. What will become of the Alliance without him... He must have taken that into account. Without the rule of House Riegan, and with most of the territory left unscathed, the Alliance will undoubtedly ally itself with the Empire. The citizen's lives will be saved from ruin, and no more blood will be shed. Perhaps that's what he wanted from the start...

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds like Claude.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of course, if his plan here in Derdriu had worked and I had lost my life...the opposite would have come to pass. The Empire would have rushed to the Alliance without further conflict. No matter how the battle unfolded, Claude secured the shortest, most peaceful possible outcome.

speaker: Hubert
text: Lady Edelgard, Derdriu is now completely under our control. As planned, the Alliance's affairs will now be overseen by Count Bergliez.

speaker: Caspar
text: My father is coming here? First west, than east... You sure keep him busy.

speaker: Hubert
text: Should the others return to the monastery and prepare to face the Kingdom?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. Thank you, Hubert. Thanks to all of your efforts, our battle with the Alliance has reached its conclusion. However, we still can't afford to be careless. We must now join the battle against the Kingdom. With the strength of the church on their side, they will prove to be a formidable enemy. More than ever, your support is invaluable. We'll need it in the days to come. But for now, let's enjoy our triumphant return!

speaker: Caspar
text: Let's get to it!

speaker: Dorothea
text: I'm so happy that the end of the fighting is near. Too bad there's still more violence to come...

speaker: Petra
text: The Kingdom and the Church of Seiros are worthy for fighting. I will crush them into very small pieces!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Crushing wouldn't yield a lot of pieces, but I guess it would get the job done. With the Professor we can't lose...probably.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh no, are we fighting Lady Rhea? But she's scary! And she'll be really angry! But no way she can stay in her spooky beast form all the time...right?

speaker: Dorothea
text: If she could, she would have come and attacked the monastery as many times as she wanted.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: It may be wishful thinking, but perhaps it is a power that she can only access when the situation is dire. But whether she is the archbishop or the Immaculate One, we cannot be stopped! Half remains, but half is finished... We are certainly moving forward.

speaker: Hubert
text: No one can stop us from pushing forward. No one.

speaker: Hubert
text: ...And that concludes Count Bergliez's report.

speaker: Hubert
text: Just as Claude said, the old Alliance has willingly fallen under Imperial rule. However, knowing him, there is no telling what manner of poison could be waiting within.

speaker: Hubert
text: Just as Your Majesty predicted, the old Alliance has willingly fallen under Imperial rule. However, even with Claude dead, there is no telling what manner of poison he left in his wake.

speaker: Hubert
text: We must be careful not to expose any weakness.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of course. Though it seems we can now attack the Kingdom without issue.

speaker: Hubert
text: True. However, you should know that Lord Arundel has entered Derdriu. It would seem he has already started collecting the Relics of the old Alliance...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Let him do as he pleases for now. It's not yet the time to chide him.

speaker: Hubert
text: Understood. As for the Kingdom... As we theorized, it is not entirely united. If we defeat the royal family of House Blaiddyd and a handful of other notable houses, it should fall under our control quite readily. Those we must target include the houses Fraldarius, Galatea, Gautier, and Charon.

speaker: Hubert
text: We have allies who are close to some of those lords. Perhaps that can be used to our advantage. Persuasion by tears or threats...Perhaps one would consent to act as an hostage? We must make good use of the tools given to us.

speaker: Edelgard
text: What about House Rowe in Arianrhod, the Fortress City? Will they not side with us?

speaker: Hubert
text: The head of House Fraldarius, Lord Rodrigue, has entered the city. It is possible that he has seized it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I see. Then it might prove too difficult to strike Fhirdiad right away.

speaker: Hubert
text: Either way, when preparations are complete, we can begin our deployment into the Kingdom.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That part of the plan remains unchanged. Professor? Is something wrong?

speaker: Byleth
text: No, it's nothing.

speaker: Byleth
text: Many of those names are new to me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, I don't imagine you have much interest in a running list of noble names. But it matters not. The nobility and the weight of it all those names will be gone once the war is over.

speaker: Edelgard
text: This month, we must put all of our effort into preparing for battle. I'm counting on you, my teacher.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Aaah!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor! You didn't hear anything just now, did you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you OK?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of course I am! It's nothing...nothing at all.

speaker: Byleth
text: That was a cute shriek.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Cute?! Huh! Well, be that as it may, it is not your concern. It was nothing.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you sure about that?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I told you it was nothing and I meant it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Really, very cute...

speaker: Edelgard
text: You seem to be trying your hardest to infuriate me. Don't you dare say that again!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Cute?! Huh! Well, be that as it may, it is not your concern. It was nothing.

speaker: Edelgard
text: It's just... Well, there was a rat. I don't enjoy the company of rats. I believe I've told you about this before...about when I was held captive beneath the palace. There were a lot of rats there. To this day, I just...

speaker: Byleth
text: What's that?

speaker: Edelgard
text: What?! Oh! Professor! Leave here at once! I recall now that Hubert needs to speak with me. I must change my clothes. Now. Whatever you do, don't look this way.

speaker: Byleth
text: I already saw it...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Aah! Then forget what you saw! That's an order!

speaker: Edelgard
text: If the Alliance falls, then the Kingdom will... There's no time to waste. If we hesitate, we risk losing the initiative. I do think we should let the troops rest, though... We must maintain morale, Professor. And let's make sure this matter stays between us. If it gets out, I'll struggle to forgive even you.

speaker: Byleth
text: What matter?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hmm... It seems you don't comprehend the consequences of angering the emperor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Understood.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you.

speaker: Hubert
text: Claude von Riegan. What an interesting character. Underneath that compassionate exterior, he was always cold and calculating. Ordinary fools run headlong into combat, without even considering the possibility of defeat. But to consider one's chances, and to prepare for plans to go awry--that takes real intelligence. I have to say, I am impressed beyond words.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The majority is with us. This conflict will end soon. I am so moved by the Alliance nobles' decision. That is true nobility! Acting in accordance with the people's needs and wishes. As war drags on, those living near the front lines inevitably get the worst of it. We will not see such a peaceful resolution in Faerghus, I am afraid, as it is ruled by the royal family, not a council of nobles.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I've been exploring the Holy Mausoleum. It's quite interesting in there. There is a mechanism I believe would allow us passage into the Holy Tomb, but I'm unclear on how to activate it. My research hasn't turned up much. It may come down to asking the archbishop for details.

speaker: Byleth
text: Your research will find something.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a puzzler.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Indeed. We'll see if it's worth the trouble.

speaker: Caspar
text: Did you meet my father in Derdriu? I guess he'll be responsible for controlling the Riegan territory and maintaining popular support. Not really sure what all that means though...

speaker: Byleth
text: You should study more.

speaker: Caspar
text: You're probably right. I'll do my best!

speaker: Byleth
text: It doesn't matter.

speaker: Caspar
text: Are you sure? I figured you'd say something about me having to study more. Oh, I get it. This is a test! I'm definitely gonna have to brush up.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: War isn't kind to you if you're a recluse. By the time you realize what's going on, you're already under attack. And if you're off by yourself, you can get killed with no one ever even finding out.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like you're learning.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that a little pessimistic?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Got me out of my room, at least! That's good, right?

speaker: Dorothea
text: The Leicester Alliance is no more. Three hundred years of history...gone and done. They write operas about events like this, you know. I'm sure they'll have a talent and beautiful songstress playing you. Probably for Edie as well. I wonder if there'll be romantic tension between your two characters, even if it's not historically accurate?

speaker: Dorothea
text: The Leicester Alliance is no more. Three hundred years of history...gone and done. They write operas about events like this, you know. I'm sure you'll be played by the most handsome actor of the time. Hearts will pound as he takes the stage. A diva will play Edie! You'll fall madly in love, even if it isn't historically accurate.

speaker: Petra
text: The Kingdom always is cold. I have hatred for the cold. Brigid is not cold. We have no Cold Spirit. Does the goddess of Fódlan give protection from the cold? I am wishing I knew how to ask her...

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. My father is holding Arianrhod secure. Our next battle will be there, against him, or in Fhirdiad, which the king is protecting.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can you fight them?

speaker: Felix
text: Ha! Don't underestimate me. I've been preparing for this for a long time.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm counting on you.

speaker: Felix
text: Hah. You just worry about yourself.

speaker: Ashe
text: Derdriu's fallen. The Alliance nobles have surrendered to the Empire. We made it through with as few losses as possible. Not bad, all things considered... But I doubt it'll be so easy to deal with Faerghus.

speaker: Sylvain
text: First Leicester and next Faerghus? Ah, that'll be really tough. Look, Professor... Fighting Faerghus? Isn't there some way we can come to an understanding?

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe there is.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah, but Edelgard and her idiot sidekick haven't shown much desire to compromise, have they?

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Harsh...but true. I don't see how we can avoid what's coming.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Truthfully, I hate the idea of planning to kill people I used to be so close with. I guess everybody feels that way though.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, Claude. I'm so relieved that he managed to make it out alive. You'll be fighting the Kingdom next, right? Then the church? Isn't there some way we can do this without fighting Dimitri and Lady Rhea? I suppose not...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, Claude. It's too late now, but it's such a shame... You'll be fighting the Kingdom next, right? Then the church? I guess Edelgard won't hesitate to cut Dimitri and Lady Rhea down...

speaker: Annette
text: We may be witnessing a key moment in history. Hundreds of years from now, your name and Edelgard's will be written in the history books, Professor!

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a little embarrassing.

speaker: Annette
text: What, how? I think it's just amazing!

speaker: Annette
text: I wonder who will decide whether we did the right thing or not... Well, it won't be us, anyway. Probably the people of a future era.

speaker: Ingrid
text: While the battle with the Alliance is over, we still need to stay vigilant. Both the church and the Kingdom are not to be taken lightly. I have the feeling we'll draw their attention soon. Weapon prep and training are of the utmost importance now more than ever.

speaker: Lorenz
text: It seems all that praise of Claude's ingenuity was largely unfounded. A truly clever man would have realized defeat was inevitable and surrendered. Or, failing that, he could have rallied the Alliance nobles to secure a real fighting chance.

speaker: Raphael
