text: I'm no noble, so it won't make much difference to me... But it hasn't really hit me yet that the Alliance is finished.

speaker: Ignatz
text: To think, I saw the end of the Leicester Alliance with my own eyes. I witnessed a turning point in the history of my homeland. I'm not sure how to express my feelings right now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why not write about it?

speaker: Ignatz
text: No, I don't have a gift for words. But perhaps I'll tell my children someday, if I have any.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why not paint a picture?

speaker: Ignatz
text: That's right, I'll paint it! The Fall of Derdriu.

speaker: Ignatz
text: So that posterity can remember our triumph.

speaker: Lysithea
text: The battle ended without House Ordelia getting involved. Although...I've no desire to continue on with my family, so from here on out, it's up to Edelgard. I have Claude to thank. Ultimately, this ended without the Alliance being entirely consumed by war. It's all thanks to Claude.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I have Claude to thank. Before the battle, he considered my precarious position and told me it wouldn't matter if we fell to the Empire. So when you invited me, I accepted without hesitation. Ultimately, this ended without the Alliance being entirely consumed by war. It's all thanks to Claude.

speaker: Marianne
text: I wonder... Was there really no way to end it without fighting Claude?

speaker: Byleth
text: It couldn't be helped.

speaker: Marianne
text: You're probably right...

speaker: Byleth
text: It's better this way.

speaker: Marianne
text: I hope you're right...

speaker: Marianne
text: I suppose the only thing I can do for him now is pray...

speaker: Marianne
text: That he may live the rest of his life in happiness.

speaker: Marianne
text: That he may rest in peace.

speaker: Leonie
text: The worst part about going to battle is knowing you might have a friend fighting for the other side. You were a mercenary, Professor. Were you always prepared for that?

speaker: Byleth
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Leonie
text: Guess I need to learn. Won't make a very good mercenary otherwise, will I?

speaker: Byleth
text: I still hesitate.

speaker: Leonie
text: That's reassuring. I don't think I'll ever get used to it.

speaker: Leonie
text: Fighting old friends--there's nothing worse. My hands shake just thinking about it.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm glad Claude didn't die. Does that make me soft?

speaker: Leonie
text: I didn't want Claude to die. Does that make me soft?

speaker: Alois
text: I've lived at Garreg Mach Monastery for a few decades now. Still, the other day I got myself all turned around! There are so many secret rooms and hidden passages. Maybe I'll take the time to properly search the place. Care to join me? I expect it'd take a whole day.

speaker: Shamir
text: You're too soft. I'm talking about Claude. Our emperor mercilessly cuts down all those who stand in her way... But perhaps she is more tolerant of those who know their place.

speaker: Shamir
text: Our emperor mercilessly cuts down all those who stand in her way... Even the Master Tactician.

speaker: Hanneman
text: It seems Claude has disappeared...

speaker: Hanneman
text: Claude...lost in battle. My goodness.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Do you suppose this means the end of House Riegan? While the Crest of von Riegan is not terribly rare... The long linage of the von Riegan family will be broken.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's just another consequence of war.

speaker: Byleth
text: We should mourn his death.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Agreed. The poor boy...

speaker: Byleth
text: Does this pose an obstacle to your research?

speaker: Hanneman
text: No... At the very least, I think not. There are other, lesser Crests to research. Yet I am a human first and a scholar second. For now, I grieve the fallen and pray for those still living.

speaker: Manuela
text: You know as well as I do, the day's coming that we'll have to fight the archbishop and her knights. We've got some strong fighters here, sure. But even with all our training, I don't know if we can win. I just don't see how any of us can compete with the archbishop, say, turning into a monster.

speaker: Byleth
text: If we must fight, we will.

speaker: Manuela
text: Yeah? What if that fight's to the death--yours and mine in particular?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sometimes it can be better to retreat.

speaker: Manuela
text: That's exactly what I was saying. I've always appreciated how you listen to me.

speaker: Jeritza
text: Neither the emperor nor the Empire have my allegiance. It is all simply part of the agreement. There is no other reason for me to be here.

speaker: Anna
text: The Alliance is just...gone. It's hard to believe. The merchants of Derdriu all have nerves of steel. I'm sure they'll be up and running again in no time.

speaker: Randolph
text: Finally, the Kingdom... After that, we'll battle the church. I volunteered for monastery guard duty. It was more for my family than anything. But now, from the bottom of my heart, I want to see Her Majesty ruling this land. Even if it costs me my life, I will protect Garreg Mach!

speaker: Fleche
text: I just wanted to help out my brother, Randolph, so I aspired to be a soldier. My brother puts his life on the line to fight, so I'll put everything I have into it too. Eventually the enemy will attack, and when they do, we'll defend this place to the bitter end!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Your next opponents will be the Kingdom's army and the Knights of Seiros. Both fearsome foes. Put the mobility of my troops to good use, and let us protect the Kngdom's western battle front. When this month has ended, I'll depart. I pray that you have good luck in battle.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You may already know this, but the Kingdom and the Alliance were once a single entity. The leaders of the Alliance, House Riegan, are actually a branch of the Blaiddyd royal family. In a way, it's just a battle of the part of Blaiddyd family tree that rose in rebellion against the Empire...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Raid from the north! Their flag bears the symbol of the Knights of Seiros! One of our troops has already intercepted them! Your Majesty, please give us your orders!

speaker: Edelgard
text: From the north? Interesting... Could it be they journeyed through Ailell, the Valley of Torment? Is the archbishop among the enemy ranks? If so, focus our attacks on her first.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Understood!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our enemy knows Garreg Mach from inside and out. They can come and go as they please. It would have been best if we had detected them sooner, but that can't be helped. Professor. We must hurry and intercept them ourselves. I'll leave the preparations to you.

speaker: Hubert
text: Heh. The battle looks to be rather cumbersome. We are still guarding all of Garreg Mach, but there are undoubtedly numerous secret passages and magic traps... There is still much about this place that we do not know. It is quite possible that they will attack from a location we cannot anticipate.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I must head out first to give my orders. I'll meet up with you soon. Call for General Randolph and General Ladislava! Hurry!

speaker: Seteth
text: It feels like only yesterday we called this place our home... We must show these fools the error of their ways. They shall pay for the sin of invading Garreg Mach...

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh, but the professor is fighting alongside our foe! The same one who saved my life...

speaker: Seteth
text: That is true... Though I find forgiveness difficult, we do owe that wayward soul a debt. However, the fact remains that because of the professor, Rhea has long been tormented. To think that the vessel of the goddess, entrusted with the Sword of the Creator, could go on to... Ah, it angers me to even think of it! All that has happened has changed Rhea. I imagine it has changed the professor as well. Even if we prevail, I doubt the church can ever fully return to the way it once was...

speaker: Flayn
text: Umm... Brother?

speaker: Seteth
text: Dear Flayn. I only brought you with me because you were so insistent. Still, no matter what happens, you must not go near the front lines. If something were to happen to you, it would utterly destroy me. You are my reason for breathing. Do you understand?

speaker: Flayn
text: I...I understand. If something were to happen to you, it would break my heart. I could not go on either. I cannot help but wonder...if there is a way to end this without fighting the professor...

speaker: Shamir
text: Our surprise attack on Garreg Mach was a success. Now we just need to break through past this point.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: We were successful sneaking up on Garreg Mach. All that's left is to break through past this point.

speaker: Alois
text: Lady Rhea and Catherine are holding back most of the Empire's army. Thereby leaving us, the expeditionary force, free to recapture the monastery!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: The archbishop and Catherine are handling the bulk of the Imperial army. That gives us the chance to infiltrate the monastery!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our enemies have followed us even here. How unfortunate.

speaker: Hubert
text: Your Majesty, the enemy's movement is suspicious. They may have some tactic in mind.

speaker: Edelgard
text: If so, then let's face them without delay. Form defensive lines and hold them to the death! Strike down all who approach!

speaker: Hubert
text: Their troop composition is also strange. I would bet that they are concealing additional soldiers.

speaker: Hubert
text: The enemy is transporting large quantities of flammable material into the woods. They clearly intend to attack us with fire. We should do all we can to prevent it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Troops waiting in the woods to ambush? We must avoid any suspicious areas as we advance.

speaker: Seteth
text: Now!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Come at me, so that I may put you out of your misery! (Flayn and several Church Soldiers appear on the right side of the map.

speaker: Flayn
text: The time is now! As long as we stand here, you shall not pass!

speaker: Alois
text: Now! Light it up! Like the goddess's fiery wrath, these flames will engulf our enemies.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Start the fire!

speaker: Shamir
text: Great. A path has opened for us.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: All right, a second route is open! Well done on this one too!

speaker: Edelgard
text: If they break through here, the monastery will be — ...If that happens, all will be lost.

speaker: Shamir
text: How much of this can you take? It doesn't matter. We will be reclaiming Garreg Mach.

speaker: Shamir
text: I knew it... Shouldn't have let emotion get in the way...

speaker: Alois
text: Shamir, no! I will avenge you!

speaker: Alois
text: You fiend, bearing ill will against the goddess. This place will be your grave!

speaker: Alois
text: Jeralt, I did it... I protected the monastery...

speaker: Shamir
text: Alois! How dare you die before me!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Our enemy's plans is in ruins. Still, we must tread carefully.

speaker: Shamir
text: You still align yourself with the emperor? What a shame. Let's make this quick. I don't want the loser to suffer.

speaker: Alois
text: Why, if it isn't Shamir! You're still with the knights. What a surprise.

speaker: Shamir
text: You're the surprise, Alois. I never thought I'd see the day you'd choose anyone over Rhea. Don't worry, I won't hold back. I owe an old ally the courtesy.

speaker: Alois
text: I won't either. I hope you're ready.

speaker: Shamir
text: I cannot bring myself to kill you... You're a princess of Brigid. A hostage of the Empire.

speaker: Petra
text: That was the truth in the past, but it is a different truth now, Shamir... I am...the will of the emperor!

speaker: Shamir
text: In that case, I won't hold back.

speaker: Alois
text: I can't believe you would try to kill lady Rhea. Jeralt must be turning in his grave. I can't protect you like I promised. I have to kill you and bury you with my own hands.

speaker: Shamir
text: So, you're the leader of the Knights of Seiros now? Good for you, Alois.

speaker: Alois
text: Indeed. You seem to be doing well for yourself too. The other knights are always cursing you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Don't worry, I won't hold back. I owe an old ally the courtesy.

speaker: Alois
text: I won't either. I hope you're ready.

speaker: Flayn
text: This makes me terribly sad, but this is my duty, to which I must be true!

speaker: Flayn
text: Farewell, Professor. I do not imagine we shall ever meet again.

speaker: Flayn
text: Father, please forgive me... I am returning to Mother now...before you do...

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn! Please, no! No!

speaker: Flayn
text: When I heard you were alive, Professor, I was so happy. But now... Now this? How can it be that you fight on that side? I cannot take your life, for I owe you mine, even now. And yet I cannot back away from this fight. When this is over, my brother and I will go into hiding. It is the only way.

speaker: Seteth
text: Trespassing on holy ground is a grave sin indeed. You must atone for it with your life!

speaker: Seteth
text: I'm sorry, Rhea... For Flayn's sake, I must take my leave to retreat...

speaker: Seteth
text: I'm sorry, Flayn... I couldn't protect you...

speaker: Flayn
text: Father! Father, why?! Why?!

speaker: Seteth
text: It saddens me to face you on the field of battle, after all you've done for Flayn. I cannot approve of your actions. But I also cannot follow Rhea on her current course. It may not change anything, but allow me to make a promise to you. If Flayn and I survive this battle, we will withdraw from the world and leave you to do as you please.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We fought them off. Good work, everyone. We've repelled the principle force of the knights and defended Garreg Mach! Hubert, I require a damage report at once.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, Your Majesty. We will have to make inquiries about the status of the main army.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Indeed. After all, it seems they had Rhea and Catherine fighting on their side.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea. The unit that invaded the monastery has been completely driven away. We were able to make a clean sweep of those who came to attack us. However, I fear we can do nothing but retreat for now.

speaker: Rhea
text: What of Seteth and Flayn?

speaker: Catherine
text: Seteth and Flayn were able to escape in another direction. I have a message from them.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am sorry, Rhea. I fear we must return to a life in hiding. I detest that person with all my heart. However, Flayn's life is more important to me than all else. I pray that you will one day be free from the burden of your work...

speaker: Rhea
text: I see. As expected, I am the only one left. Mother, please wait for me. I promise that I will save you...The filthy thief who stole you from the Holy Tomb...I will crush them with my bare hands!

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea! I am afraid I must report...we lost Seteth and Flayn. We were able to make a clean sweep of those who came to attack us. The unit that invaded the monastery has been completely driven away...a bitter disappointment. I fear we can do nothing but retreat for you.

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth... Flayn... First my mother, and now those two have been stolen away as well? Must you take everything from me?!

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea...

speaker: Rhea
text: No amount of repentance will bring your wretched soul salvation. You will be chained to the Valley of Torment...eternally walk the desert until the skin rots from your bones... I will ensure that you pay for your sins, Professor! In the name of the Nabateans, I swear it!

speaker: Randolph
text: Edelgard... Your Majesty... I am so sorry...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Silence. We must tend to your wounds.

speaker: Randolph
text: It will do no good. I can't be saved... You must know that. Ladislava has also passed... The enemy has withdrawn... You are safe now...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Understood. Good work. Another loss on my watch... As more blood wets my feet, they grow heavier with each step. Remorse, resentment, despair... I have dispensed with all such things to come this far.

speaker: Hubert
text: And we must keep moving forward...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hubert. Tell me the status of the enemy.

speaker: Hubert
text: The battle has ended in a draw with severe injuries on both sides. Some known commanders have been slain.

speaker: Hubert
text: The most worthy of mention among the dead was the second in command to Rhea herself, Seteth.

speaker: Hubert
text: With the death of Alois, the Knights of Seiros have taken a huge blow as well.

speaker: Hubert
text: Garreg Mach has not taken much damage, and so it would not be out of line to claim it as a victory for us.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes... We'll call that a victory. Although, I'm sure they will say the same.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, Your Majesty.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ugh, what a terrible opponent that was! Why is the church always like this?! How am I supposed to train for that?! It was way too scary!

speaker: Linhardt
text: When I saw the enemy enter Garreg Mach, I prepared myself mentally for death. I thought it would be a fine time to die, but I suppose it wasn't quite the time after all...

speaker: Petra
text: Our luck was good to have grabbed victory. The church has great strength. We must not have grief, but must keep fighting. Can we be fighting now?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: This was certainly a momentous victory. We lost a lot, but we also gained a lot. Certain lords in the Kingdom have examined the situation again and decided to join our cause. Changing their fealty based on just one battle... They are all a disgrace to the nobility!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Today, our enemy held many faces I knew well... If we must fight to the death with that kind of opponent, what will become of this world?

speaker: Caspar
text: There's no stopping me! I'm ready go strike the Kingdom here and now! Everyone must see that we can easily unite Fódlan! Don't you think?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Excellent job, everyone. The battle is over now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, the battle is over now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: While we have sustained heavy losses, our foe has suffered far more.

speaker: Hubert
text: Although not exactly as planned, a win is a win. It may be safe to say that there will be no more obstacles on our way to the next battle.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We will break through the Tailtean Plains and then set course for Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital. The final chapter of our fight with the Kingdom and the church is close at hand.

You... How long do you intend to sleep? Your body is awake. Your eyes must open now, and you must find the strength to stand upon those legs of yours. Like so much rain, a pool of blood has fallen to the ground... As spears and arrows pierce the earth, it weeps. And even now...it weeps. In order to survive, they kill. And so, the people of this world are lost in an abyss of suffering. They weep as well. The only one who truly knows the nature of such things is I... Or rather, you.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm still sleepy.
You are a complete and utter fool! Have you not changed one bit?!

speaker: Byleth
text: Who?
Excuse me?! Are you saying you have forgotten who I am? How dare you!
Get on your feet. Right now! I'll coddle you no more! You are just like a child, always needing me to hold your hand...

speaker: Villager
text: Hey! A-are you awake?

speaker: Byleth
text: Where am I?

speaker: Villager
text: We’re in a village at the base of the monastery. What are you doing in a place like this?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who are you?

speaker: Villager
text: I’m just a villager here. What are you doing in a place like this?

speaker: Villager
text: I honestly didn’t expect to find someone floating away down the river... Garreg Mach is upstream of here, but that place was abandoned.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Villager
text: Huh? You don’t know? The Church of Seiros isn’t there anymore. Though there have been some folks still living there in the five years since... Well, you know. Regardless, the Imperial Army has taken over now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Five years?

speaker: Byleth
text: What year is it?

speaker: Villager
text: Um, are you feeling all right? You didn’t hit your head or anything did you? It’s the Ethereal Moon of the year 1185. It’s been nearly five years since the monastery fell. Tomorrow was supposed to be the Millennium Festival, but who’s got time to think about things like that?

speaker: Byleth
text: The millennium festival...

speaker: Villager
text: Uh, yeah, that’s what I said. But with the war and the archbishop still missing and all, I doubt there’s a soul to be found who has enough blessings worth counting.

speaker: Villager
text: Hey! Slow down, will ya? Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Byleth
text: The monastery.

speaker: Villager
text: Are you crazy?! The Imperial Army is there! Come on, I promise I won’t say you’re a coward. Just forget about going anywhere near the monastery.

speaker: Villager
text: You just remember I tried to stop you, got it? It’s not on my conscience if you wind up dead.

speaker: Byleth
text: My students are waiting for me.

speaker: Villager
text: Students? You really are crazy, aren’t you? There aren’t any kids anywhere near that place anymore.

speaker: Byleth
text: No need to worry about me.

speaker: Villager
text: Unbelievable...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Five years ago to the day... If things had continued on as they were, today would have been the Millennium Festival.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Halt! Who's there?!

speaker: Edelgard
text: It can't be! Professor? Is it really you? But I searched everywhere and never found a trace! My teacher... what have you been doing all this time? Where have you been?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was sleeping.

speaker: Byleth
text: I was dead.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Joking?! At a time like this?! You do realize it's been five years since you disappeared!  Do you have any idea how guilty I felt? How broken my heart was? I searched high and low after you vanished! Although there was no proof, I somehow knew you were still alive. All this time, I led everyone as best I could, and fought with all my heart. It's been a difficult path to walk alone.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Welcome back, my teacher. I'm so happy that you're safe. Five years... Such a short time, but it fells like an eternity ago. Do you... still feel the way you did all those years ago? You said that you would fight at my side no matter how many enemies we should amass. As for me, my resolve has not faltered. I'm determined as ever to see this through to the end. I will defeat the false goddess. I will save this world from those creatures and give humanity its freedom back.

speaker: Edelgard
text: So, my teacher, are you prepared to stand with me?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I...I thank you. Truly. Now then, I assume you understand the situation at hand, yes?

speaker: Byleth
text: I really was asleep all this time...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Another joke. Or...are you telling the truth? I suppose you must be. In that case, I'll tell you all that has transpired as you slumbered these past five years.

speaker: Edelgard
text: ...And that is where we are now. The war is at a stalemate. Dimitri is the new King of Faerghus. It's clear that his territory will continue to support the Church. Meanwhile, Claude's leadership has thrown the Alliance into chaos. He maintains neutrality in their internal conflict. The situation has created a deadlock. We've been awaiting an opportunity for our squadron to return to the monastery. With you in the fray, I believe the state of the war will shift immediately. The Church, as well as the Kingdom and the Alliance... The time has come to eliminate them all.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Kingdom and the Alliance...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Although we were of different houses, we were companions who lived and learned together. Some of our ranks are hesitant to battle against them. However, knowing that you're alive is sure to raise their spirits.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Church of Seiros...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Rhea, Seteth, the knights, and the others are in prime condition. They've set up their base within the Kingdom capital. The Immaculate One and her family have yet to fight on the front lines. However, we must eventually face and defeat them. It would mean a great deal to have you with us when the time comes.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Good. Well then, I believe it's time for a little reunion. The Black Eagle Strike Force never lost faith. They knew you were alive and have been awaiting your return. Let's not keep them waiting any longer.

speaker: Hubert
text: Well now. That face is certainly familiar. I am glad to see you alive and well, Professor.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor, it's me, Bernie! Do you remember me? I can't believe you're here!

speaker: Caspar
text: I can't believe it! Is this a dream? Can we really be this lucky?!

speaker: Petra
text: This is not dreaming. Our professor is with us again!  Welcome to the back! I mean, welcome back!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Our group isn't the same without you. I am overjoyed to see you again!

speaker: Dorothea
text: It's been so long. Seeing you again fills my heart with hope.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Great, now everything will be easy.  Um, that's great you're safe, Professor. I'm deeply, deeply moved.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Quite the reunion, isn't it, Professor? Everyone's happy to see you.

speaker: Caspar
text: Come on, Edelgard. You must be happier than all of us combined!

speaker: Caspar
text: She took it really hard when you disappeared, Professor.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Of course, we did our very best in your absence. And there was never a day that we doubted you would return to us.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Edelgard has been leading us as emperor. But...after you disappeared, it became apparent that you were her anchor.

speaker: Petra
text: It gives me regret to be admitting this, but...our power is not enough. The only one who can be meeting Edelgard's expectations...is you, Professor.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Most impressive of all is your uncanny ability to bring a smile to everyone's face.

speaker: Hubert
text: In the years since you vanished, we have not lost anyone from our ranks.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We all longed for your presence and your leadership. Myself included.

speaker: Hubert
text: It seems fitting to view this as a new beginning for the Black Eagle Strike Force. We already have our target.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. We must eliminate the Alliance before moving on to fight the Kingdom and the Church. However, that doesn't necessarily mean we must occupy the entirety of the Alliance. House Riegan stands against the Empire... Therefore, our target is Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital.

speaker: Hubert
text: We must cross the Airmid River, which separates the Empire and the Alliance. To do that, we must take the largest bridge across it. The Great Bridge of Myrddin. Myrddin connects the monastery and the Imperial capital to the east. It is the shortest route there.

speaker: Edelgard
text: An Alliance stronghold has been built at the Great Bridge. We'll take that and then head north. At the same time, we must defeat the one who defends it, Judith von Daphnel. If we can also take control of Daphnel territory, it would be greatly beneficial to us. Prepare yourselves. The next battle will be a momentous one. Join me, my friends, as we begin our journey to bring peace and solace to this war-ravaged world.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor... I'm sorry to have dragged you into the fight again so soon after our reunion. But you appeared at a most opportune time. I'm truly humbled by your support, my teacher. Thank you.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can count on me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: And so I will. I'm hoping your ability from five years prior are still intact.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope I'm not rusty...

speaker: Edelgard
text: You may be worried, but you shouldn't be. You always manage to pull through.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Make sure you're ready to head out, OK?

speaker: Hubert
text: Allow me to brief you on the details of our situation. The Empire firmly controls the western portion of Faerghus. However, the central and eastern regions continue to put up heavy resistance. The strongholds in these regions are Arianrhod, the Fortress City, and Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital. We cannot control Faerghus until we have taken both of these cities. As for the Alliance, Houses Gloucester and Ordelia seem predisposed to to capitulate to us. However, due to interference from Houses Riegan and Goneril, we have yet to secure their cooperation. Claude obviously hopes to keep the Alliance whole through diplomacy. But because we have had to focus our efforts against the church until now, our forces have yet to meet his. We have only recently begun to take the fight to Alliance territory.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The last five years have been difficult at times. My relationship with Edelgard is rather contentious, due to the incident with my father. Nevertheless, I cannot abandon my family's duties. As Duke Aegir, I must play my part in the Imperial army. Edelgard intends to abolish the nobility, but I know I can dissuade her from doing so.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Professor! Do you know how happy I was to hear you were still alive? I'll tell you how happy--for the past two days, I haven't had my morning or my afternoon naps.

speaker: Byleth
text: Morning...nap?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes?

speaker: Byleth
text: You were taking those naps every day?

speaker: Linhardt
text: Well, as long as we weren't marching. Can't sleep much then...but it's not for want of trying...

speaker: Linhardt
text: By the way, with Professor Hanneman not around... I've occupied his room. So I am well equipped to perform research on you. Isn't that exciting?

speaker: Caspar
text: All right, I'm ready to fight! Let's do this!

speaker: Byleth
text: Whoa, slow down.

speaker: Caspar
text: You're right! I gotta keep it under control or I'm gonna wear myself out too quickly. Maybe I'll just get rid of a few monsters...or is that too risky right before a mission?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm counting on you.

speaker: Caspar
text: Leave it to me! I can take on the whole...most of the enemy's army!

speaker: Caspar
text: I know my limits now, Professor!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Are we leaving for battle? I heard it's a long march. But it's fine! I've had plenty of time to stay inside lately, so I think it's time I...went out. Yeah! I can do this. No more Bernie-bear!

speaker: Byleth
text: Bernie-bear?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh yeah. People call me Bernie-bear since I hole up in my den all the time. Not anymore though!

speaker: Byleth
text: That's the spirit.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Yes! But, um. Please don't put me up front, OK?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

speaker: Petra
text: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be...difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means the common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will...ah, will turn. I have certainty.

speaker: Felix
text: For five years, I've fought for the Empire. I've cut down hordes of enemies. Now I have the same look in my eyes that the boar used to have in his. The look of a savage beast who loves nothing but destruction and violence.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't see that look in your eyes.

speaker: Felix
text: I hope not.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're right.

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. I can hardly hold it against him anymore.

speaker: Felix
text: You and Edelgard must not disappoint me. Mark my words. The future you're building had better be worth all this bloodshed.

speaker: Ashe
text: Since you came back, everyone's been smiling. Just you being here makes an incredible difference. I can't express how reassuring it is to see you.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Professor. It's been a really long time, hasn't it? The last five years have been full of heartbreak-not from girls...but friends and family becoming enemies. One of the things that kept me going was the hope you'd return, and now here you are. A lot has changed, but you're back, and it's the first time I can remember being happy in a while.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I have good friends in both the Alliance and Faerghus, so this fighting weighs heavily on me... I can't bear the thought of battling the Knights of Seiros to the death! I have to keep my chin up though, right? Let's press on together, Professor.

speaker: Annette
text: My father used to be a knight in service of the royal family of Faerghus. For a time he was at the monastery, but apparently, he's back in Faerghus serving as a knight again. Which means if I fight with this family, I'll eventually have to face my own father...

speaker: Byleth
text: If you want to leave, now is the time.

speaker: Annette
text: Don't say that! I know what I'm doing and I'm ready for anything.

speaker: Byleth
text: Does that frighten you?

speaker: Annette
text: Terribly. But...I've accepted my fate. I'm ready for anything.

speaker: Annette
text: Of course, if at all possible, I would prefer not to fight my father. This is the path I chose. I have no regrets.

speaker: Ingrid
text: His Highness, the new king, is in process of unifying the Kingdom under his command. His powerful army has joined forces with the Knights of Seiros, who moved their seat to Faerghus. And now they're presenting a unified front against the Imperial army. They're our greatest enemy, absolutely.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if we can win.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Presently, it's doubtful. That's why I'm in favor of first capturing Alliance lands.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can you fight against your homeland?

speaker: Ingrid
text: I don't relish the idea, but there's no turning back now. For now, we should focus our efforts on the Alliance. The Kingdom and church can come afterwards.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Judith, who defends the Great Bridge of Myrddin, is a formidable opponent. We can't afford to drop our guard.

speaker: Lorenz
text: House Gloucester will remain staunchly neutral in this war. Even if we press into Alliance territory. My father is no threat to the Empire. Lady Edelgard surely understands that. The Great Bridge of Myrddin, however, is another story. I hear it is held by Judith of House Daphnel. She is renowned for her military prowess. We would do well not to underestimate her.

speaker: Raphael
text: Hey, Professor! What have you been up to for five years? Hope you haven't gone soft! I got myself into perfect shape. Took all five years of pushing my muscles to the limit, but look!

speaker: Byleth
text: You look very strong.

speaker: Raphael
text: You bet I do! You gotta get training if you want to catch up!

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't really see a difference...

speaker: Raphael
text: What?! Can't you see my muscles? Do I gotta undress so you can get a better look?

speaker: Ignatz
text: I thought you might be at the monastery. That's why I made my way here. I decided to follow your path, because I believed in you. But then you vanished. Now that you've returned, I have my guiding light once again. Welcome back, Professor!

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm relieved you're here, Professor. It seems we've reached a stalemate on the war front. I admit I'm feeling apprehensive about fighting the Alliance...

speaker: Byleth
text: You have to cast aside your doubts.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I agree. It's time to shelve my personal feelings and focus on the bigger picture.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have to do anything if you don't want to.

speaker: Lysithea
text: No. I have to shelve my personal feelings. There are bigger things at play here.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'll fight at full force. I'm counting on you to lead us to victory, Professor.

speaker: Marianne
text: My adoptive father sent me here so our family name would be known. He doesn't care which side wins, the Empire or the Alliance. However, even if he tells me to come home, I intend to stay. I want to see this new world Edelgard dreams of.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm so glad to see you're all right. I really regretted not being able to keep the promise I made to my mentor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Mentor?

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt, obviously! I'm still his first and greatest apprentice, you know!

speaker: Byleth
text: Promise?

speaker: Leonie
text: Captain Jeralt told me that if anything should happen to him, then I should stick by you.

speaker: Leonie
text: I'm going to do just what he asked. I'll be right here to support you from now on.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah!

speaker: Byleth
text: Ah?

speaker: Alois
text: At long last, we meet again! I knew you were alive. I knew you could survive. And five years on, you arrive! We're reunited! I'm glad I kept watch for you in the downstream villages all that time. I was so devoted to finding you that I left the Knights of Seiros. Now I serve no one... Other than you! I'll protect you, just as I promised Captain Jeralt I would all those years ago.

speaker: Shamir
text: What's that look on your face? Surprised to see me? I'm a mercenary. Always have been. Even when I was with the Knights of Seiros. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon. But I might change my mind if you're around.

speaker: Hanneman
text: You've finally joined us, haven't you? I attached myself to the Imperial army as well. Seemed the thing to do. I feel I owe it to Edelgard to set my past feelings about the Empire aside. I am happy to help her. It's strange, isn't it? After five years, the three Professors are together once more. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can talk about that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, maybe later...

speaker: Hanneman
text: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

speaker: Manuela
text: After the battle five years ago, the Imperial army occupied Garreg Mach. The cathedral and several other buildings were destroyed, but... We've done some repair work here and there, and we're using the buildings as a base of operations. As for me? Well, the church moved its headquarters to Faerghus, and I've seen no reason to follow. When I returned to Enbarr, I received a summons from Her Majesty, and I chose to answer.

speaker: Jeritza
text: You survived. How very fortunate... Were you dead, I wouldn't be able to fight you. But you are very much alive—now I've a chance to kill you.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Randolph
text: Ah, a new face. I am Randolph von Bergliez. I'm the guardian of this place. Wait a moment... I'm sure I've seen you somewhere before.

speaker: Byleth
text: Five years ago...

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm a professor.

speaker: Randolph
text: Ah yes! You're Her Majesty's professor. You're alive?! Um... Oh, this is my little sister, Fleche. She's just a rookie, but she's helping me as my assistant.

speaker: Fleche
text: H-Hello. I'm Fleche von Bergliez. It's nice to meet you. I know I'm inexperienced, but I'm going to do my best. You can count on me to look after my big brother!

speaker: Randolph
text: I heard you're planning to march into Alliance territory. I'll be here to guard the fort.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! What's that? Do I have brothers in the church? You really are well informed! My older twin works for the Knights of Seiros, but I think he's just a grunt. Not a noble gate keeper like yours truly. Unlike me, he's very devout. He left the Empire a long time ago.

speaker: Hubert
text: We are about to commence the attack on the Great Bridge of Myrddin. But first, allow me a moment of your time.

speaker: Byleth
text: What do you need?

speaker: Hubert
text: It is something I can only ask of you. Listen well... It concerns Lady Edelgard's uncle. The regent of the Empire, Lord Arundel. Although he is currently cooperating with Her Majesty, he maintains his own sizable military troops. It seems to me that his plans differ from our own. I assume you recall a certain group's scheming from five years ago. Solon and Kronya... They both served Lord Arundel.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why must we cooperate?

speaker: Byleth
text: He must be dealt with.

speaker: Hubert
text: Professor, I understand how you must be feeling, considering what they did to your father. I know it must be foul to even consider cooperating with their kind. However, their power is essential for us at present. Edelgard also strongly opposed the idea at first. Our enemy is the Church of Seiros itself. It cannot be toppled with the Empire's might alone. Those working under Lord Arundel are extremely hostile toward the church. And the enemy of our enemy is... Well, I think you sufficiently understand by now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you sure that's a good idea?

speaker: Hubert
text: Until all of Fódlan is united, it is a necessary evil. As for how we deal with them afterward...time will tell. Regardless, Her Majesty and I wish to join our power with yours.

speaker: Hubert
text: You should know that in her heart, Her Majesty regards that group as enemies of herself and her family. They used her father, the former emperor, as a puppet and murdered her siblings with their vile experimentation. I believe Her Majesty may have told you some of this herself. That is why this was a...very painful decision for her to make.

speaker: Hubert
text: I will do all I can to ensure her suffering is not in vain, and I hope I can count on you to do the same. As for all I have told you, please keep it in mind as we march forward. More importantly, I implore you to fight as best you can for Edelgard... From the bottom of my heart, I beg this of you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We'll be capturing the Great Bridge of Myrddin, a key strategic location of the Leicester Alliance. Claude will surely be sending reinforcements, so we must prevail before they arrive.

speaker: Hubert
text: Our opponent is Judith, the so-called Hero of Daphnel. We can handle her. So long as we don't get careless.

speaker: Judith
text: The boy said to run if I was in danger, but... I could never do that. I'll hold out until reinforcements arrive!

speaker: Leonie
text: Judith! I'm so glad you're safe! Claude sent me here with reinforcements!

speaker: Alliance General
text: Sorry to keep you waiting, Judith! We're the reinforcements!

speaker: Acheron
text: Why do I have to put up with orders from that false leader...

speaker: Leonie
text: Because you're from the smallest noble house in all the Alliance, you whiner!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Enemy reinforcements... We didn't finish in time. Don't let them secure the ballista!

speaker: Ignatz
text: I am helping Claude build the future of Fódlan!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Ungh... I should have known this would happen...

speaker: Judith
text: Ignatz! Damn it... Such a good kid. He died too young...

speaker: Leonie
text: Judith, I'm sorry... I leave the rest to you...

speaker: Judith
text: Leonie! You had such a full life ahead of you... I wish I could take your place...

speaker: Leonie
text: Doesn't matter who you are. I won't hold back, and I won't fall to the Empire!

speaker: Leonie
text: You're all Captain Jeralt's enemies! And I will avenge him here!

speaker: Judith
text: This is it... Claude, I'm sorry. I couldn't defend the bridge. All who are able, retreat!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Don't let her escape! If we take her out now, the Daphnel territory will be ours! That will allow us to march safely through the Alliance.

speaker: Judith
text: Avoided death yet again, huh? I'll join Claude and prepare for a counter attack!

speaker: Hubert
text: Judith's escape will widen the battlefront. Our strategy's failed...

speaker: Judith
text: Guh, it looks like I'm done for. Claude... I'm sorry...

speaker: Leonie
text: Judith! No!

speaker: Acheron
text: The knights on the other side of this bridge are mine. I can't just let you cross!

speaker: Acheron
text: Guh... If only I had joined the Empire...sooner...

speaker: Ignatz
text: We can't place the future of Fódlan in Edelgard's hands. If you're allied with the Empire, I have no choice but to fight you.

speaker: Raphael
text: Outta my way, Ignatz! I don't wanna have to fight you!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Stop deluding yourself. You joined the Empire. Didn't you consider the consequences? I don't want to fight you either, Raphael! But this is war.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ignatz...

speaker: Leonie
text: Professor! You know Captain Jeralt's killer was connected to the Empire! Why did you side with them?! Answer me, traitor!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Acheron! What a pleasant surprise! I was concerned I might have to kill someone decent.

speaker: Acheron
text: Ha! House Gloucester is already finished. I've already taken control of your land!

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's quite enough of your spinning, Weathervane. Time for you to die.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Alliance soldiers, Judith has fallen! Further conflict is futile! If you surrender, your lives will be spared. Lay down your weapons immediately.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You have all fought well. With this victory, we now have a foothold in the Alliance. The Imperial Army will cross the Airmid River and push the front lines forward. The fight will continue, but do not allow that to stop you from taking pride in our hard-won victory.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, this should put a stop to one of Edelgard's choice phrases. Well done, Professor. I believe it was "if only the professor were here, we could forge ahead and change the tides of this war."

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ferdinand. It is not necessary to tell the professor such things.

speaker: Caspar
text: We're not the only ones benefiting! The whole Imperial Army is stronger now!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, it seems the Empire finally has both of its legs to stand on. Don't you agree?

speaker: Edelgard
text: You make it sound as though I can't run the Empire on my own. Perhaps it's more apt to say that the pegasus has recovered its horn.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Judith of Daphnel... What a magnificent warrior. I'm happy to have the professor back just like old times, but I don't think I'll ever get used to this cruel exchange of lives...

speaker: Petra
text: When there is something you must not be conceding, you must keep fighting! The fighting has been continuing for five years, but now I am again witnessing the professor's power.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I hate fighting! But...with the professor here...maybe it's slightly less terrible? Oh, but everyone is working so hard! Stop it, Bernie, you can't be the only one complaining!

speaker: Hubert
text: I'm glad to see everyone so inspired. It seems the reappearance of the professor has done much to raise your morale.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Do you not feel the same, Hubert? Come now, be honest with yourself. Now, we must take advantage of the situation and blaze ahead. Our path is still a long one.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We somehow managed to escape.

speaker: Hubert
text: This is one of the Imperial army's provisional camps. Here we can organize our forces.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Before we go any further, I want all of you to really ask yourselves if you're certain you wish to join us. As expected, Flayn has chosen to leave our ranks.

speaker: Caspar
text: When I saw our professor running off, I ran about as fast as I could to catch up.

speaker: Petra
text: Caspar. Death finds those who run without thinking. You gave no thought to the war fog.  My grandfather was the leader of Brigid, and I hope for us to be allies with the Empire. I will be staying.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: W-Was this a good idea? Did I make the right choice? Oh, but my family is part of the Empire, and our professor is here...

speaker: Caspar
text: You're fine here with us, Bernie. Though it's true that certain houses were against the Imperial princess...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I assume you are referring to my family. I must believe that the conclusion I came to was the correct one.  You are the emperor now... I am the only one left who is qualified to guide you at this point.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'm only here because I know it would be troublesome to stand against you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I'm not just here for you, Edie. I'm here to follow our dear professor. Of course, I don't have any territory to offer... so Hubie may not even want me here.

speaker: Hubert
text: The greater our numbers, the better. Your reasons for being here are of no consequence.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I think I understand where you are coming from. But now, I wish to hear of your resolve. Like you, I have risen to meet my destiny. I cut this path, and I will see it through to the end. Following me is akin to pointing a sword to the goddess herself. One misstep, and we fall to ruin. You have now witnessed the archbishop's true self. She is a cruel beast. Those who rule this world use that beast's power to fabricate miracles, all to control those who blindly believe in the goddess. They conceal the truth and force their lies on the nobility. They mercilessly annihilate anyone who defies them. I know this because I have lived it. After what you have seen, is there any room for doubt? The Church of Seiros has great influence and power. Their control over the lords of the Kingdom and the Alliance is nearly absolute. We are the only ones who can stop this indomitable enemy that has plagued our world for ages. We fight for humanity! For all of Fódlan! If you dare walk this path with me, take your first step. It's now or never!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you, my friends. We are the true face of the Empire, and we will triumph!

speaker: Hubert
text: That was incredible, Lady Edelgard.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you. Honestly, I'm relieved. They really chose to follow me... I was resolved to move forward alone if I had to, but in my heart I hoped it wouldn't come to that.

speaker: Hubert
text: So long as I am here, you will never be alone. Please do not forget that. And...it would seem that the professor also has a key role to play in this.

speaker: Edelgard
text: You're right. Now, I must speak with our teacher. Please, make preparations. The messenger should be here shortly.

speaker: Hubert
text: Consider it done.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, may I speak with you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I appreciate it. I...

speaker: Byleth
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm just...anxious. It feels like the weight of this burden is crushing me. At this very moment, on my orders, I'm starting a war. An army far larger than the one that attacked the Holy Tomb last month will soon be locked in battle. Long-devised strategies are unfolding across Fódlan. Leaders are deciding their loyalties and preparing to fight... So many generals and soldiers will die. It's inevitable that civilians will get caught up in the chaos as well. There will be countless casualties. With a single command, the flames of war will rage across all corners of this realm. And I am the one who is giving the order.

speaker: Byleth
text: This is the path you chose, isn't it?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes, it is. There is no turning back.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you wish to stop?

speaker: Edelgard
text: No. There is no turning back now.

speaker: Edelgard
text: No matter how much blood flows at my feet, I will not relent. We must break the bonds that the depraved church has placed on Fódlan. These sacrifices will allow us to create a future where we never need sacrifice again. It may seem contradictory, but it's the only way. Heh. Listen to me. I made up my mind long ago. Yet here I am, seeking your approval. Tell me the truth, my teacher. Are you happy with your decision to stand by my side. Unlike me, you can still walk away from all of this. This path leads to the death of the archbishop and the servants of the church. Can you live with that?

speaker: Byleth
text: I chose this path too.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I never thought... I'm sorry. It was a foolish question. I believe in you, professor. And you believed in me. With that knowledge, I have the strength to keep fighting. Let's go... There's something I need to say to Hubert.

speaker: Hubert
text: Your Majesty, the latest report indicates that our main army is advancing as planned. Also, the preparations for your manifesto are almost complete.

speaker: Byleth
text: Manifesto?

speaker: Edelgard
text: We will distributing our manifesto to every lord within Fódlan. We will expose the dark side of the Church of Seiros and the foul practices of the nobles from the Kingdom and the Alliance. We will force the people of Fódlan to open their eyes to the truth and relinquish any remaining conviction to unite against the empire. Certain nobles have already offered their support.

speaker: Hubert
text: There are other nobles who oppose the church. We will condemn those who deserve condemnation and forgive those who deserve forgiveness. We have already purged some of the Imperial nobles who are morally rotten. My father among them. How unfortunate.

speaker: Edelgard
text: And soon we will invade and conquer Garreg Mach. Our main army has already departed the Imperial capital. They will arrive at the monastery in two weeks' time. There, we will join forces with them. As for us, I'd like your opinion on how we should be positioned within the army.

speaker: Byleth
text: We are the Imperial shield.

speaker: Byleth
text: We are the Imperial sword.

speaker: Hubert
text: Your majesty wishes to fight alongside the professor, correct? In that case, you will not be incorporated into the Empire's main army. Your squad can move freely about the battlefield under supervision of the Imperial forces... That would be most prudent.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Now that I'm the emperor, we can't let it slip that I'm following your command in battle, Professor.

speaker: Hubert
text: I fully object to the notion of you fighting on the front lines.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hubert. We've already discussed this.

speaker: Hubert
text: My apologies... I overstepped.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Now that the details are settled, all that's left is come up with a name for ourselves. In honor at our time at the academy, how about we call ourselves the Black Eagle Strike Force?

speaker: Byleth
text: I love it.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm so happy you feel that way. I must confess that I spent all night thinking about it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I hope we can live up to that name.

speaker: Edelgard
text: With you as our leader, I'm confident we will. To me, that name represents us soaring toward a new dawn, freely as an eagle.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that a bit much?

speaker: Edelgard
text: It seems we have differing tastes. I suppose we'll have to agree to disagree.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'll leave it to you to prepare the Black Eagle Strike Force for departure.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We will join forces with the main army and attack Garreg Mach. It's a fortress built on steep ground, but it's never seen battle. That means we don't know much about it from a military perspective. But if we use all of the power at our disposal, we will capture it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if we can win.

speaker: Byleth
text: We have to try.

speaker: Edelgard
text: From a purely mathematical standpoint, we most certainly have the power to win. If the battle becomes a clash of beasts with inhuman strength... You will be our only hope. I believe in you. I'm relying on you to lead the Black Eagle Strike Force to victory.

speaker: Hubert
text: It is not up to Her Majesty to bring the students to our cause. That task falls to you. Those who have forsaken their homelands to join the Empire will be feeling...vulnerable. You are uniquely able to provide emotional support. Please use that gift to guide others down the path that Lady Edelgard has laid before us. I ask you to do this from the bottom of my heart.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I asked Edelgard what happened to my father. He was dismissed as prime minister and is under arrest in the Imperial capital. He always was a greedy, arrogant man. Some would say that this is the fate he deserves. And yet I cannot help but feel indignant. After all his hard work for the Empire, to be disgraced like this! I am conflicted, Professor. I do not know what to do. As the next Duke Aegir, should I follow Edelgard into battle?

speaker: Linhardt
text: The most important nobles in the Empire are known for taking power from the previous emperor, my father included. I didn't think it possible that the Imperial princess could ascend the throne so easily. However, it seems that both my father and Caspar's are supporting Edelgard... Having both the Minister of Domestic Affairs and Minister of Military Affairs on your side gives you total control over the Empire's military and finances. They must have been making preparations for quite some time without anyone noticing...

speaker: Caspar
text: That could have gotten dangerous fast. If I stayed at the monastery, I would've had to fight my father! We aren't especially close, but he's not an opponent I'd want to face. I'd almost rather fight a monster! Anyway, it looks like he's going to be leading the western units. I wonder if we'll wind up fighting the Kingdom's army, and who decided to fight for the church...

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't even get my own room here! At least I had that at home. But speaking of home, Hubert told me something. He said my father was stripped of his title. I guess he did as he pleased and opposed Edelgard. Wait, does that mean my father's going to be home all the time now? On second thought, I think I'm fine right here.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Edelgard became emperor and raised an army, huh? Who knew the kid had it in her? I mean, yeah, of course, I knew she'd be emperor eventually, but... The more I think about it, the more surprised I am. I wonder who's going to win?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's worrisome.

speaker: Dorothea
text: It is. We might have to fight against others from the academy, and that's... I can't think about it.

speaker: Byleth
text: We will not lose.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Thinking about it makes me scared. We're fighting the Knights of Seiros! Still, I know you'll figure something out.

speaker: Petra
text: The Empire and Brigid were once warring with each other. But now, I have made the decision to be fighting with the Empire. It is a choice of irony, I feel. But I am having no regret. My belief is with you and with Edelgard.

speaker: Felix
text: I've been preparing to take this path. My own path--not my old man's, and not the boar's.

speaker: Ashe
text: I can't bring myself to trust the Church of Seiros. Not after they killed Lonato and my brother. I need to know the truth. Even if it means...turning my weapon on Faerghus. I guess Lonato would be happy to hear me say that, if he were still around.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I've gone and done it now, huh? What would my old man say if he knew I'd sided with the Empire? His Highness must be angry. Dimitri gets super scary when he's like that. I wonder how I'm going to die... Ugh, my knees turn to jelly just thinking about it. No, I can't think that way. I promised to fight alongside you. I'm here until the end. Heh, listen to me. I'm terrified, but I feel so calm.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Surely this is what the goddess willed, isn't it? I feel she would not have wanted the Church of Seiros to become what it has...

speaker: Annette
text: Um, Professor... I'm OK with fighting whoever we need to, but I really don't want to battle my father... Oh, but I know that something is wrong with the church... And more than that, I believe in you, and I trust your word. You lead and I'll follow.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I may return to Galatea territory and try to convince my father to join our cause. It's possible that... No. In my heart, I know that my father won't never listen. Still, I must get him to see reason. That this is the only way to ensure our family's future.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I've decided to ally myself with Lady Edelgard. Father will doubtless understand my reasoning. House Gloucester has always had good intentions in its dealings with the Empire. Of course, this does mean that I will no longer be able to avoid a confrontation with Claude. It is unfortunate. We were classmates, after all.

speaker: Raphael
text: No need to worry about me. I got no complaints as long as my little sis is safe. Sure, I lived on Alliance land, but that doesn't mean I served their lords. I'm sure this is the right path, seeing as you're the one who picked it, Professor!

speaker: Ignatz
text: To think that things would come to this. Even a few months ago, I never could've imagined it. I believe in you, Professor, so I'm steeling myself. I can't promise that I'll be useful in battle, but I'm not running away from the fight.

speaker: Lysithea
text: If the church is behind the current state of things--this society in which only Crests are valued--then I have no need of it. Edelgard is taking the shortest path to change. No matter how drastic her measures, I agree that this is the only way. That said, if Edelgard strays from her noble path, I trust you will set her straight again. Won't you? I am counting on you, Professor.

speaker: Marianne
text: Imagine making half the world your enemy for the sake of realizing your own ideals... Edelgard is so radiant and strong compared to someone like me... What if I have the power to change the world too? Even just a little bit...

speaker: Leonie
text: So, you've turned against the church to ally with the Empire too, huh? I never pressed him for details, but Captain Jeralt was always suspicious of Lady Rhea, wasn't he? I'm on your side, no matter what. I promised him I'd support you, and that's what I plan to do.

speaker: Ladislava
text: I believe this is the first time we have met. My name is Ladislava. I have the great honor of leading Lady Edelgard's personal guard. Her majesty is hard on others as she is on herself. She may seem composed, but that is only because she conceals her more passionate emotions. For that reason, she is often misunderstood. But now she has you by her side... I find that most reassuring. I look forward to working with you.

speaker: Randolph
text: I'm Randolph von Bergliez. I'm not very high in the ranks yet, but I'm more or less a general. Just like Caspar, I am from House Bergliez. My mother married into House Bergliez after I was born, so my position within the family is rather lowly... But I'm determined to make something of myself in this battle to bring glory to my part of the family, for the sake of my mother and sister!

speaker: Edelgard
text: We will soon arrive at Garreg Mach Monastery. Forcing a surrender here is extremely significant, both strategically and symbolically. Of course, this is personal as well. This is where we all came together to learn and grow. I have no intention of yielding to our former classmates, so I ask that you prepare yourselves for anything.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'm not thinking about friends right now, and I'm certainly not prepared.

speaker: Caspar
text: Damn it, don't go around saying things that lower morale before we even get started! I'm ready! Let's go! Let's fight!

speaker: Dorothea
text: I have nothing to lose aside from my friends who are here with me. Does that answer satisfy you?

speaker: Petra
text: I have been ready for this since leaving my land of home. I will fight and win!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: How can you prepare to fight? Maybe I can prepare to prepare...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: There is no reason I cannot be prepared. It is my duty to stand up and battle!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Thank you all. Now, let's talk strategy.

speaker: Hubert
text: As the raiding force, we will attack the area nearest to the monastery. The Knights of Seiros certainly won't stand down after they catch sight of Her Majesty and the professor. At the same time, the remaining areas will be surrounded and annihilated by the main army. In other words, we are the decoy that must suppress the enemy's most elite soldiers.

speaker: Edelgard
text: We know more about the area near the monastery than anyone else in the Imperial army. Still, we must prepare for the worst. It's possible we will have to face the archbishop's true form--the Immaculate One. Fight with all you have, but don't be reckless. As promised, I will leave the command to the professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: We will not lose.

speaker: Hubert
text: Naturally. With both Her Majesty and yourself on our side, defeat is impossible.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will protect you all.

speaker: Hubert
text: Not only will we all survive this, but we will undoubtedly emerge victorious.

speaker: Edelgard
text: This will be our first battle as the Black Eagle Strike Force. All the more reason to prevail!

speaker: Seteth
text: Friends! Our opportunity for victory will come, but first we must see to our defenses!

speaker: Hubert
text: The city's defenders are trying to stall for time. We must crush them swiftly. We should be wary of ambushes as well.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Ladislava is being pushed on the left flank. We must push back with equal force.

speaker: Ladislava
text: Just what we need! I knew Her Majesty's allies would help us out.

speaker: Ladislava
text: Apologies for the trouble, Your Majesty!

speaker: Death Knight
text: We will lend the Empire strength...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Don't worry. We're allies now... I understand you must have many questions, but they'll have to wait until after the battle.

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth, Flayn, Gilbert... You put your lives on the line to protect us. I would have preferred to have more time to prepare, but we cannot delay any longer. Come forth! Protect Garreg Mach Monastery from these despicable rebels!

speaker: Catherine
text: I'll crush them all.

speaker: Cyril
text: Her enemies are my enemies.

speaker: Flayn
text: You shall not pass! I will protect Garreg Mach!

speaker: Flayn
text: Must protect...Garreg Mach... I must protect...everyone...

speaker: Seteth
text: Retreat while you still can, Flayn! I beg you!

speaker: Flayn
text: Understood... Stay safe Fa--Brother!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Unfortunately, you must die here. You should never have defied the goddess.

speaker: Gilbert
text: In my master's name, I cannot allow myself to fall here... I must withdraw.

speaker: Seteth
text: You will survive this hardship! Just hold on!

speaker: Seteth
text: I will show no mercy to anyone who attacks Rhea!

speaker: Seteth
text: I cannot yield...

speaker: Flayn
text: Seteth! Please, do not overextend yourself! I am still in this fight!

speaker: Seteth
text: I'm sorry, Flayn... Withdraw if you must...

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, why?! Do you not see the cruelty of this?

speaker: Gilbert
text: If you side with the Empire... If you turn your sword on the church and the Kingdom... I care not who you are. I will end you just the same.

speaker: Gilbert
text: Annette, throw down your arms!

speaker: Annette
text: I'm sorry, Father. But I have made my choice. I'm not going back to the monastery, to the Kingdom, or to you, Father!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Forgive me, Goddess. Annette. If you side with the Empire, I will have no choice but to kill you.

speaker: Seteth
text: Traitor! I will not forgive you for turning on Rhea!

speaker: Catherine
text: I am Thunder Catherine, and I will slay all of Lady Rhea's enemies. Including you.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea, I'm sorry. Please stay safe.

speaker: Rhea
text: All is well, Catherine. You must not die here.

speaker: Cyril
text: I gotta kill you!

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea, I couldn't fight hard enough. I'm sorry...

speaker: Rhea
text: Cyril... Your sacrifice will not be in vain.

speaker: Rhea
text: So you have sullied yourself by joining with the rebels? I hope you came prepared to breathe your last.

speaker: Rhea
text: Raaaargh!

speaker: Catherine
text: I trusted you. Lady Rhea trusted you. I won't let you live after what you've done.

speaker: Cyril
text: I'll protect Lady Rhea against anyone! Even if it's you, I'll fight ya as hard as I can!

speaker: Rhea
text: You... How dare you betray me... You worthless piece of garbage... I will punish you myself!

speaker: Rhea
text: No matter your reasons, I cannot permit you to go on living any longer!

speaker: Edelgard
text: The feeling is mutual. I must put a stop to your reign of tyranny!

speaker: Rhea
text: You must know what a fool you are! The greatest of sins is to make an enemy of the goddess herself!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I have only made an enemy of the church, not of the faith.

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: You will not be forgiven!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor, look out!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: The castle is crumbling! We must escape!

speaker: Hubert
text: Professor, take cover!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Professor!

speaker: Dimitri
text: So... Arianrhod has fallen. Rodrigue... I swear that I will not allow your death to be in vain...

speaker: Dimitri
text: So... Arianrhod has fallen. Rodrigue, Felix, Ingrid... I swear that I will not allow your deaths to be in vain...

speaker: Rhea
text: The scouts have just now returned. It seems the Imperial army is marching toward the Kingdom capital. Are you certain about this, Dimitri? As king, do you think it wise to intercept them yourself?

speaker: Dimitri
text: No need to worry yourself. Even if I am defeated, the Blaiddyd bloodline will live on. And the Kingdom's territory has never been rich in resources. If the castle falls under siege, our loss is inevitable. I will deploy my army onto the plains and wait for the enemy. Please position your forces so that they can flank the Imperial army.

speaker: Rhea
text: Yes, given the present situation, making the plains our battlefield is a logical choice. I have no objection. However...

speaker: Dimitri
text: There is only one person I am after. I have no interest in any other prey.

speaker: Rhea
text: I will take you at your word. Erasing the other child's existence is my task, and mine alone. I will get you back, Mother... I promise...

speaker: Hubert
text: What do you think, Lady Edelgard? Will they shut themselves inside of Fhirdiad?

speaker: Edelgard
text: They will try to intercept us. Of course, Fhirdiad will not fall so easily. Even so... If were to cut off their supply with a large army, it would eventually fall. It makes much more sense for them to wager everything on a victory at the Tailtean Plains.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Tailtean Plains...

speaker: Edelgard
text: The same plains where the so-called divine Seiros defeated Nemesis, the King of Liberation, in a comeback victory over 1,000 years ago. And about 400 years ago, the hero Loog created the Kingdom by defeating the emperor of the time on those very plains. Their goal must be to recreate that scene.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes, I suppose so. Although the Imperial army is powerful, if we were to compare the strength of our best to the best of the Knights of Seiros, we would likely come up short. The Kingdom's army and House Blaiddyd are also renowned for their unmatched persistence. On the battlefield, it can be assumed that their one and only goal will be to strike you down.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Are you telling me to stay off the battlefield?

speaker: Hubert
text: Naturally. You are their aim, Your Majesty. You must know it only makes sense to keep you out of their reach.

speaker: Edelgard
text: And you must know that, at a time like this, I absolutely cannot withdraw.

speaker: Hubert
text: Of course I know that. That is why I will refrain from asking you again to stay away from the battlefield.

speaker: Edelgard
text: The Immaculate One, descendants of the 10 Elites, and other extremely fearsome foes await us. But with the help of our friends, we have a chance of defeating them. We're the only ones who can. Within our group, I am included among those with the king of strength we need to win. I absolutely will not remove myself from the front lines. Professor you have that same strength as well, whether or not you realize it yet.

speaker: Byleth
text: Of course.

speaker: Edelgard
text: As emperor, I must not die in this war, and it would be unacceptable to lose you as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: I will protect you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Please, don't get yourself killed trying to protect me.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Until the very end, we'll survive this trial together. Understood?

speaker: Edelgard
text: This month, we will take all of the military force we can muster and advance to the Kingdom capital of Fhirdiad. I have no intention of retreating to Garreg Mach after we've come this far. We will only return after we've conquered Fhirdiad and put an end to this war. Be sure to steel your heart and ready yourself for the battle ahead.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm ready for anything.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Are you certain? If so, please help me raise the morale of our allies.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll do what I can.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I'm sorry to burden you, but please look after our allies as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure I'll be ready in time...

speaker: Edelgard
text: We have no choice. I have every faith that you are capable of this.

speaker: Hubert
text: Tch. Lord Arundel. As long as he exists, Lady Edelgard will...

speaker: Byleth
text: Just who is that man?

speaker: Hubert
text: I believe I have explained before that he is the one who commanded the likes of Solon and Kronya. Cornelia, whom we defeated Arianrhod, was also one of his. An irksome sort. We must not fail to be rid of him. He is a maggot, crawling in the filth of the world, feeding off the Empire like a parasite.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital... From the Empire's perspective, it seems like the northernmost edge of the world. I have come a long way, following you and Edelgard. To think, what if I had succeeded Duke Aegir as prime minister? I would never have had all these experiences.

speaker: Byleth
text: You've really grown up.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I hope that is true. I used to be so naive...

speaker: Byleth
text: You'll always be a noble, through and through.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Please do not tease, Professor. I think all of this has changed me a little bit.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: For now, let us join together and walk the path that Her Majesty lays out.

speaker: Linhardt
text: When you think of it, as one approaches the end of a war, the sacrifices only grow larger, don't they? The winning side musters their forces and attempts to strike a decisive blow... While those of the losing side make desperate attempts to turn the war in their favor. Neither side will give. I only wish we'd consider those who lose their lives in that struggle.

speaker: Byleth
text: We're far from safe ourselves.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, exactly my point. Let's be careful to ensure we don't lose our own lives, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a necessary sacrifice.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Perhaps, but that doesn't make it any easier to accept your own survival depends on a throw of the dice.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's better than dragging the war out.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I can appreciate that, but just because a choice is better does not mean that it's good.

speaker: Caspar
text: All right! Off to the Kingdom's capital we go! Huh. I feel like I've said that before.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're imagining things.

speaker: Caspar
text: My imagination, eh? You usually know what you're talking about. Still, this is gonna bug me...

speaker: Byleth
text: It's not your imagination.

speaker: Caspar
text: Yeah, you usually know what you're talking about. I just can't remember when I woulda said it!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's head for the Kingdom capital!

speaker: Caspar
text: All right! I'm fired up and ready to go!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor! What should I do!? Everyone's acting like this is leading up to the final chapter in a book or something! Is the battle ahead really going to be that climatic? Am I not taking it seriously enough?!

speaker: Byleth
text: You're doing just fine.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: You think so? All right, I believe you. I'm...ready for this. I am. Yeah! We're going to win!

speaker: Byleth
text: You could be showing more resolve.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I know, I know, but I...don't wanna die!

speaker: Byleth
text: What you really need to do is relax.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Yeah, you're probably right. I should take a breath and try to calm down.

speaker: Dorothea
text: We're almost to the Kingdom capital of Fhirdiad. Just imagine...the war might almost be over. But is it true that Arianrhod was annihilated?! What in the world happened?! What is the Seiros Church, really?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll find out if we conquer the Kingdom capital.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Fair enough. Let's just focus on this battle right now.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's impossible to say right now.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Of course, Professor. I trust you, OK?

speaker: Byleth
text: For now, just trust in me.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I always have, and I always will.

speaker: Petra
text: I have...worries. What have I been achieving? When the war is ended, I will be returning to Brigid with many...much new potential. But have I had enough growth to become the ruler?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes. You should be proud.

speaker: Petra
text: I have gratitude. I will take your words into my heart.

speaker: Byleth
text: Only you can answer that.

speaker: Petra
text: This is the truth. I will fight with all of my strength so that I will know with certainty!

speaker: Petra
text: Brigid pride, technique, and culture... I will be showing all of the world who we are!

speaker: Felix
text: They used to call my father the Shield of Faerghus. Now he's gone, and Arianrhod has fallen. Yet the Knights of Seiros remain. As does the boar. What terrifies me most is his stubbornness. He'll keep on fighting to the last man. He's a monster. I've seen it firsthand.

speaker: Ashe
