text: I hear that House Blaiddyd commands some strong and well-trained troops. People say they're fiercely devoted and will gladly die for their king. Reminds me of Lonato's men-the ones we faced back in Magdred. Unlike those civilian soldiers though, here we're up against the best that the Faerghus army has to offer. It's going to be a hard battle, but if there's a peaceful tomorrow waiting on the other side, it'll be worth it.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I've been thinking about how we've got our own ideas about justice...and so does the Kingdom. And what's coming, it's not just a battle between us and them. It's our ideals that are fighting. Whoever wins will say they were right and the other side was wrong. That's how it goes... But nobody's willing to talk or compromise, so we'll fight to the death to prove the other guy's wrong. It won't be an easy battle, but let's make sure we come back alive. Right, Professor?

speaker: Mercedes
text: When I first enrolled in the Officers Academy, I never thought it would come to this. I can't believe we're waging war...against the church, no less.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you regret it?

speaker: Mercedes
text: There are some things that I regret, but I don't think I made the wrong decision.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you ready to face this?

speaker: Mercedes
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Even if our enemy is Lady Rhea herself, I am prepared to fight.

speaker: Annette
text: I'm sure my father will be waiting in Fhirdiad. If I can avoid it, I'd rather not fight him... But I don't think my father is capable of betraying the royal family...of betraying Dimitri. I must be prepared to do...what I have to.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm counting on you.

speaker: Annette
text: Right!

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't push yourself too hard.

speaker: Annette
text: I'm alright. I still stand by my decision to trust in you.

speaker: Annette
text: Professor... Let's make sure we win!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Claude was known as the Master Tactician. There wasn't a situation he couldn't strategize his way out of. Whereas, King Dimitri is known as the Tempest King. He is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. We still haven't ever faced him head-on. Can we do this?

speaker: Byleth
text: We can.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Yes. Of course we can! I'm sorry. I let my uncertainty get the better of me.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'll see this through.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Ah, Professor. Ever the reliable one.

speaker: Ingrid
text: We have you, and we have Edelgard. Not to mention many other allies we can rely upon. Together...we can overcome even the most formidable foe!

speaker: Lorenz
text: Personally I take no issue with attacking Lady Rhea. But the eagerness of my fellow nobles does vex me, despite so many grand displays of piety from them in the past. It gives me the impression that faith is little more than a tool they use to maintain their positions of power.

speaker: Byleth
text: Disappointed in the nobility?

speaker: Lorenz
text: I suppose I am in no position to judge them, being among their number myself. Still, it irritates me.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is religion obsolete, then?

speaker: Lorenz
text: If it is no longer useful as a tool, then I expect the nobles will cease to give it any credence.

speaker: Lorenz
text: What is a noble's duty, truly? I hope we will discover an answer in the conflict ahead.

speaker: Raphael
text: Hyah! Next up's the Kingdom capital! We're coming for you! Whoa. That sounds familiar. Have I said that before?

speaker: Byleth
text: You're imagining things.

speaker: Raphael
text: Really? You're probably right. It's not like we've invaded the Kingdom capital before.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's not your imagination.

speaker: Raphael
text: Really? Does that mean we've invaded the Kingdom capital before?

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's head for the Kingdom capital!

speaker: Raphael
text: Yeah! Let's do it, Professor! I just gotta get my muscles prepped and ready first!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Once the Kingdom capital falls, all of Fódlan will be united under the banner of the Empire. Isn't it thrilling? We're going to make history.

speaker: Byleth
text: Only if we win.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Well, yes, I suppose that's true.

speaker: Byleth
text: Unless we lose.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Hah! I don't think that will happen.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's stay calm and focus on the battle.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Yes, of course! I'll do my best.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Our opponents may be strong, but with you on our side, we can't lose!

speaker: Lysithea
text: If we win this battle, it will be an end to the Kingdom, and to the church. Under the Empire, an era of peace would begin... Many people are cleaving to this notion, but I wonder if it would really end up as such.

speaker: Byleth
text: It will.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Such resolve. It's convincing, to say the least.

speaker: Byleth
text: It won't.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I worry as much myself.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's hard to say.

speaker: Lysithea
text: It's true—it's nothing but hypotheticals at this point.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I wonder... Was the collapse of Arianrhod really the church's doing? Or could it be that... Hm. Never mind me. Just thinking aloud.

speaker: Marianne
text: Dear Goddess...

speaker: Byleth
text: Praying again?

speaker: Marianne
text: Yes. I was praying for your safety.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you praying for?

speaker: Marianne
text: Um...for your safety.

speaker: Marianne
text: I'll do all I can to survive, but please...please don't die out there, Professor.

speaker: Leonie
text: Looks like we're finally getting to the end of this thing. Don't go dying on us now, all right?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not a chance.

speaker: Leonie
text: Ha! I like your confidence.

speaker: Byleth
text: Same to you.

speaker: Leonie
text: Not planning on it.

speaker: Leonie
text: If you're still alive when this is all over, then I'll have kept my word to Captain Jeralt. Let's both live to see the dawn of a bright new age!

speaker: Alois
text: I wonder would the captain would say if he knew we were planning to take down Lady Rhea. Lady Rhea and Captain Jeralt went back pretty far. But hey, it's your decision! I'm sure he would have understood in the end. Now, onward to Fhirdiad! I'm ready!

speaker: Shamir
text: The idea of defeating Rhea is beginning to feel more like a reality. Some may say that I'm returning her goodwill with betrayal, but I believe I've worked off my debt. The real problem is a certain someone else.

speaker: Byleth
text: Catherine?

speaker: Shamir
text: That's right. She was my partner, after all. I haven't seen her since leaving the knights...

speaker: Byleth
text: Cyril?

speaker: Shamir
text: I taught him some archery, but we are of different birth and hold different values. I was speaking of Catherine.

speaker: Byleth
text: Gilbert?

speaker: Shamir
text: I have no particular interest in him. I was speaking of Catherine.

speaker: Shamir
text: I can see her coming to slaughter me. Driven by her mixed emotions of love and hate.

speaker: Hanneman
text: When Edelgard first invited me to join this army, I, to be frank, thought her dream utterly ridiculous. But at my advanced age, I was tempted by the notion of chasing a seemingly impossible dream through blood, sweat, and tears. Five years on, the unification of Fódlan is slowly becoming a reality. Now I feel... It may soon be possible to abolish the nobility, and create a world where none need suffer due to crests.

speaker: Hanneman
text: You need not say anything. I will stay by your side, and hers, to the very end.

speaker: Manuela
text: Professor, do you mind if I complain about something, well, personal? Of course you don't. This army is almost all single men. If that marital status came before or during the war, I'm not to say... The point is, I'm in charge of the infirmary. I wind up treating hundreds of men every week. I get to talk to all sorts of men, from all walks of life, all of the time. And yet...

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't have a boyfriend?

speaker: Manuela
text: No! Not one of those men is infatuated with their caregiver! Isn't that supposed to happen in wartime?!

speaker: Byleth
text: You aren't married yet?

speaker: Manuela
text: Forget that, I can't even find a boyfriend! Marriage is just—pffftt! A joke! Just a sick joke.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe you should give up on love.

speaker: Manuela
text: Yeah... I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

speaker: Manuela
text: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

speaker: Jeritza
text: The war is at its end. Has the time finally come that I might kill you?

speaker: Byleth
text: The battle will continue even beyond the war.

speaker: Jeritza
text: It is true... Those petulant fleas must be picked off one by one. There are nothing if not persistent.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's no guarantee that we'll win next time.

speaker: Jeritza
text: And if we do not win, then we die. Either has its charms.

speaker: Anna
text: Seems like the war is gonna end soon. Once the dust settles, it'll be back to rolling in fat stacks of gold for me!

speaker: Fleche
text: Ah! Did you want something?! Sorry, I was a bit lost in thought... Or rather, I was thinking about work. My brother had sorted out all his personal affairs, but apparently he'd forgotten about his work duties. So now I've got a ton more work on my plate... Oh, Brother, why must you be so careless... Once this war is over, I'm gonna take a vacation and get some well-earned rest back home with my mother.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! The time has finally come to set out for the Kingdom Capital, Fhirdiad. I thought the same thing last month, but I still can't believe the plan was to ambush Arianrhod. I know it couldn't helped, but even I wasn't let in on the secret. Me! Not gonna lie...that hurt a little. Ah well, let's forget about that! I'm praying for your victory and your safe return!

speaker: Jeralt
text: Sorry... It looks like...I'm going to have to leave you now. (groans) One day, I hope you'll give this ring to someone you love as well as I love her.

speaker: Byleth
text: (Someone I love...)

speaker: Seiros
text: Mother... Oddly the rain has come to fall yet again. At this place, once again... I will fight to take you back... The one who keeps me from seeing you again... I will be sure to return them to the earth from whence they came. The foolish descendant of Hresvelg who bares her fangs at me will suffer the same fate...

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Lady Rhea...

speaker: Seiros
text: Call me Seiros now. I am no longer the archbishop, but rather a warrior.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Yes, Lady Seiros. Because of the rain, we have not yet confirmed the position of our enemy or of the Kingdom army...

speaker: Seiros
text: Search the route to Fhirdiad. It is unlikely that they have strayed far from it. When you discover the Imperial army's main force, commence the attack. If the Kingdom's army has already engaged, flank the enemy as planned.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: As you wish.

speaker: Seiros
text: Wait for me, dear child... I will be paying you a visit soon... When this sword has been plunged into your chest... Yes, that is the very moment I have long for...

speaker: Dimitri
text: I was hoping they would strike the church first... We must have miscalculated the rate of their advance. Reorganize the formation. We have no choice but to buy time until the church arrives. It will be a long battle... Are you afraid, Dedue?

speaker: Dedue
text: No. So long as I am at your side, there is nothing to fear.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I can always rely on you. Just watch, my friend... We will prevail. I will not fail to get revenge for all who have fallen.

speaker: Dedue
text: I would follow you anywhere, Your Majesty. Good luck out there.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You as well, Dedue. You as well.

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Majesty... For you, I will...

speaker: Edelgard
text: A flag of blue is flapping in the rain... It must be the Kingdom army.

speaker: Hubert
text: Yes. It seems that King Dimitri is leading the troops himself. However, the Knights of Seiros have yet to be seen. Perhaps they have split up.

speaker: Edelgard
text: I can't imagine that Dimitri would leave the capital to the church and face us with the Kingdom army alone. He must be planning to use the church to gain the upper hand in battle. With the rain, that must be difficult to coordinate... Still, the Knights of Seiros must be around here somewhere.

speaker: Hubert
text: Then we should be on alert for attacks from the side and rear as well. Inform the entire army.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Hubert
text: Now that I think about it, the Kingdom's Army is quite different than it once was. They have taken a position of interception. In the past, the king would have introduced himself before beginning a fair fight.

speaker: Edelgard
text: A fair fight... The words alone remind me of how he once was. Don't you agree, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who might that be?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Oh, have you forgotten already? Dimitri often spoke of such things back at the monastery.

speaker: Byleth
text: Dimitri?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. He often spoke of such things back at the monastery.

speaker: Byleth
text: Claude?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Of all the people in the world, why would talk of a fair fight remind you of Claude? I'm talking about Dimitri. Have you forgotten? He often spoke of such things back at the monastery.

speaker: Hubert
text: Well, at the present, the words fair fight do not seem to suit Dimitri anymore. He dislikes making victims of his friends, but other than that, he will do most anything these days... If he stops at nothing to continue the onslaught, I cannot imagine what will become of the battlefield.

speaker: Edelgard
text: True. As soon as we can take our battle formation, we must advance. Dimitri, that past you cling to... I will soon free you from it.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Ah, here you are, Edelgard...at your eternal resting place. You have trampled and stolen and blinded yourself to the truth. Today, I will have vengeance for all you have done!

speaker: Edelgard
text: With this battle, the main force of the Kingdom will be annihilated! Leave no enemy general alive. Least of all King Dimitri!

speaker: Hubert
text: We are uncertain of the enemy's plans, so let us advance our troops with caution. The Knights of Seiros have yet to show themselves. They will join the battle at some point. Be ready.

speaker: Kingdom General
text: We're first in line! Charge!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Don't let this chance for vengeance go to waste!

speaker: Sylvain
text: Time to join the front lines. We should all show a little loyalty from time to time, yeah?

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Glory to the flag of the knights! Good fortune to His Majesty! Fortune...to Faerghus... Graaaaargh!

speaker: Hubert
text: What the— That Kingdom soldier just changed into a Demonic Beast. Did Thales... No. This is something simpler.

speaker: Dimitri
text: This is the work of a Crest Stone... But why...

speaker: Dedue
text: I gave them Crest Stones from the castle vaults.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You fool! Why did you do that?

speaker: Dedue
text: If we lose here, the Kingdom falls. It's our only hope.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You call this hope?! Well, we must now claim victory so their deaths were not in vain.

speaker: Dedue
text: Yes, Your Majesty. I am with you.

speaker: Kingdom General
text: Gautier reinforcements have arrived! We shall crush the Empire weaklings!

speaker: Mercedes
text: Don't worry everyone! The reinforcements have arrived!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Reinforcements... We're in danger. We must defeat the enemy's generals before we're overwhelmed.

speaker: Hubert
text: This battle may turn against us if we allow any more of them to transform. We don't know which soldiers have Crest Stones. We must do away with all of them, and quickly!

speaker: Rhea
text: How could I be late, when I finally have the opportunity to destroy the fallen one? This rain...it is the lamentation of my mother... Observe. I shall not fail in restoring balance.

speaker: Sylvain
text: So what are you waiting for? Let's finish this today.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor! Has it really been five years? We ought to raise a glass for the occasion. Celebrate your return. Nah, I'd rather commemorate it with your death.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, there's something I should admit. I've got some regrets about how our lives have gone. I should have made a proper attempt to woo you before now. Instead, I have to kill you.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Stand down, Ingrid. I know you don't want to die here.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I will not. I'll never ally myself with the likes of you.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Stubborn as ever. I always did like that about you.

speaker: Ingrid
text: And you never cease to amaze me with your false flattery. Don't waste your breath.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I was such a fool. So...this is how it ends. Forgive me, Your Majesty. I'm...going on...ahead.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Thank you, Sylvain. Until we meet again on the other side...

speaker: Mercedes
text: It makes me so sad to fight against you, but I suppose that's how things go when you're at war. Why follow an emperor who would start such a war?

speaker: Mercedes
text: I'm sorry, Professor. I can't join you... There are important things I must stay and protect.

speaker: Annette
text: Mercie...

speaker: Mercedes
text: Now now, Annie. There's no need for that. This is a battlefield, after all.

speaker: Annette
text: I'm so sorry... You know that, don't you? And also know that you don't have to forgive me...

speaker: Mercedes
text: I was going to say the same thing. I'm so sorry if I cause you any pain.

speaker: Jeritza
text: Step back, Mercedes.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I won't. This is the path I have chosen. It's the same for you too, Emile. Is it not? Someday, we may meet again in another life. Whenever that happens, I hope that we'll remain side by side, always...

speaker: Jeritza
text: My dear sister... I am sorry.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I'm...I'm sorry, Dimitri... I can't seem to stay...on my feet.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Forgive me, Mercedes. Were it not for me, you wouldn't have gotten caught up in all this, and you might still be alive...

speaker: Dedue
text: You will never understand the burden His Majesty carries on his shoulders!

speaker: Dedue
text: It is a shame. I really believed you would come to believe His Majesty's perspective.

speaker: Dedue
text: It is time. Your Majesty... I will avenge your father. You are the one true king...Dimitri. Grr... Grrrr!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue! I will fight by your side until the bitter end... As long as I am with you, this lance of mine will know nothing of defeat!

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Majesty...you must survive...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... You fought well, my friend.

speaker: Dedue
text: Urghh...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... You fool...

speaker: Dimitri
text: You will not kill one more soul. You will not steal one more thing. I will not allow it. Here and now, I stand against you!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Why did you choose Edelgard, Professor? Why did you choose to walk this savage, bloody path? I cannot shake this feeling of regret... Regret that I must kill you now.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Must you continue to conquer? Continue to kill?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Must you continue to reconquer? Continue to kill in retaliation? I will not stop. There is nothing I would not sacrifice to cut a path to Fódlan's new dawn!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Enough of this madness! This future of yours is built on a foundation of corpses and tears!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Not only have you become the emperor's lap dog, but you have turned against your own people. From the depths of hell, you will regret tainting the land of Faerghus!

speaker: Dimitri
text: You killed Rodrigue... your own father, Felix.

speaker: Felix
text: I said I'd cut down anyone who stood in my way. Even my father. Even my friends.

speaker: Dimitri
text: I see. That was all I needed to hear to finally work up the resolve to kill you.

speaker: Dimitri
text: No! Not yet... I can't die just yet...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Dimitri, you idiot! Retreat! Wait, your injury... No!

speaker: Dedue
text: Fall back, Your Majesty! We cannot lose you!

speaker: Seiros
text: King Dimitri! There is no retreat for the Knights of Seiros! Fight until none are left standing! Slaughter them all and send them straight to hell!  No... It can't be... There is no retreat for the Knights of Seiros! Fight until none are left standing! Slaughter them all and send them straight to hell!

speaker: Seiros
text: You are all damned, with no hope of salvation. For the sin of insurgency, you shall be consigned to hell!

speaker: Seiros
text: I once walked this world as Seiros, the warrior... and defeated the Fell King Nemesis. Now, here I stand, facing one who wields the same sword as he... The fate you have chosen is also the same as his... To die in torment upon my sword, as the very lifeblood you have forsaken spills onto the earth!

speaker: Seiros
text: An ancestor of the Hresvelgs, who became Adrestia's first emperor... He saved me. Supported me. Gave his all to the cause of defeating Nemesis. That I should find myself here at Tailtean, striking down his scion...

speaker: Edelgard
text: I don't advise presumptions, Rhea. I will not die by your hand.

speaker: Seiros
text: How can this be? I lost to that thief?! Unacceptable!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Watch out, Lady Rhea! Please retreat!

speaker: Seiros
text: Gyhh!

speaker: Dimitri
text: The Church of Seiros has fallen back, but we have no such luxury. Everyone, fight for your lives! Victory to Faerghus!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Edelgard! You... I will kill you! You will know the regret of my father, who was killed for you! Of my stepmother, who was slain by her own daughter! You will bow your head before all the lives you trampled for your ideals before you die in misery!

speaker: Edelgard
text: Your obsession with me is appalling. If you were a normal human, you would most certainly have died already. Farewell, King of Delusion. If only we were born in a time of peace, you might have lived a joyful life as a benevolent ruler.

speaker: Dimitri
text: To the fires of eternity with you...El...

speaker: Dedue
text: Your Majesty... Your Majesty!

speaker: Dimitri
text: Stop calling me that.

speaker: Dedue
text: Ah, thank the... No...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Dedue... It seems I will die...before I can get revenge for everyone...

speaker: Dimitri
text: My family, my friends, my home... Everything that truly mattered to me... I couldn't...

speaker: Dedue
text: You're wrong! Because of you, I was able to live on until today. You saved me. These past nine years... I am proud to have been at your side. It was a joy I never could have hoped for. Despite all, I count myself a lucky man.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Is that so? I see... I am glad...

speaker: Dedue
text: You must be weary, Your Majesty. Please...rest in peace.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Lady Rhea! King Dimitri has fallen in battle! The Kingdom's army has retreated! It is impossible to preserve the front line!

speaker: Seiros
text: Gah... Everyone withdraw immediately! Fall back to Fhirdiad! The goddess is watching over us! If we hold strong we will surely be saved!

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Understood! Retreat!

speaker: Seiros
text: Why do you insist on being such a loathsome obstacle... You stole my mother's heart and wield the Sword of the Creator. Just like that savage King Nemesis... I swear...with these very hands... I will take her back... Until then, wait for me, dear Mother...

speaker: Edelgard
text: Rhea... She is our enemy, but I must admit that she plays her cards magnificently.

speaker: Hubert
text: You mean using the goddess's name in order to boost morale?

speaker: Edelgard
text: That's true, but she also shows great skill in devising her tactics. Using the bewildered Kingdom army as a shield while she and the knights retreated... If they ran all the way back to Fhirdiad, it will be very difficult to pursue them.

speaker: Byleth
text: Can we defeat them?

speaker: Edelgard
text: If you're low on confidence, Professor, I'll put an end to this myself. Actually...that's what I'd like to say, but in truth I hope to confront them with you at my side.

speaker: Byleth
text: Next time, we will end this.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. Together, we'll end this once and for all.

speaker: Edelgard
text: For all of the lives lost in battle, by our allies and foes alike... And for Dimitri, as well...

speaker: Byleth
text: For Dimitri?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Yes. The thirst for revenge that imprisoned him was the result of my uncle's strategy. He believed that I was the cause of everything...and he lost sight of his path as king. There was nothing I could do to save him. And so, the very least I could do was--

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you crying?

speaker: Edelgard
text: No. The Edelgard who shed tears died many years ago. Everything that's happened...it's all just part of the ebb and flow of history. The Tragedy of Duscur, our days at the academy, Father's death, and the five years you were gone... After all of that, at long last, we're here at this point in time. I hope you'll stay by my side until the very end. It's time for humanity to take this world back.
